Reviews.Title: “Between the Beach and the 5th Avenue stroll on 8th:”
Reviews.Author: Crasch42
Reviews.Content: The Illusion is a wonderful, clean and very friendly hotel 100 yards from the beach and 40 yards from the evening stroll and restaurants of 5th Avenue. The Illusion Hotel has agreements with both beach front hotels at the lower end of 8th to use their lounges and food and drink service with a note from the front desk and the hotel's blue and white striped towels. It makes the Illusion a beach front Hotel on a quiet street that has little traffic except for city and restaurant services. We had a balcony overlooking the street. The sounds were not a problem. There is a roof top pool for soaking, a bar, lounges for sunning, a roof top "Honeymoon cabin" and a massage facility along with a view of Cozumel Island. The boats to Cozumel dock a short walk away. This will always be our hotel when we return to this beautiful town. The consierge arranged our trips out to the archaeolgical sites and Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: tmeyer01
Reviews.Content: I think we got spoiled by getting room 408 which opens up right on the rooftop deck/pool/bar area overlooking the coast. Our room was great and strongly recommend requesting this one. Large room, fridge, microwave, bed, futon, huge shower with great pressure, nice A/C. Didn't really use any services from the hotel but the staff seemed helpful and courteous. Some of the other rooms may not have the best view and I think their balconies were pretty small but can't say much about them since I didn't see them. Only about 100 feet from 5th ave and maybe 200 feet from the beach. Didn't even need to put sandals on. Only complaint I had was the noise from the club a block or two away. Most of the time I didn't hear it very much with the windows closed but our last night there the wind was blowing from the north and we were on that side and heard it loud all night. I do recommend.

Reviews.Title: “First stay won't be the last!”
Reviews.Author: moabman2415
Reviews.Content: A quick introduction to Illusion for a 2 night stay March 1 & 2, 2012 was not disappointing. We'll definitely be back for more. The location in Playa was outstanding for us, a 1/2 block walk east to the beach. Same walk distance west going up to Fifth Ave for shopping, dining, people watching, etc. The staff at Illusion was outstanding and extremely friendly and we couldn't be more pleased with their professionalism. We had a 3rd floor room and thought the view from the roof pool/bar (4th floor) area was nice. Room was superb, clean and roomy. The mattress was a bit too firm on the bed however, our only drawback to an outstanding stay. A very good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Illusion Hotel, Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: My companion and I just returned from Playa, having stayed at Illusion Hotel. We have been to Playa many times but this was our first time at Illusion. Overall, we were very happy with Illusion. We had booked a standard room, but then the hotel staff sent us an email offering an upgrade to a Prestige room so we took the bait. We were both very happy that we did! The room was on the 4th floor. It was large and comfortable, with a king size bed, futon, fridge, microwave, and especially nice (and rare in MX), a coffeemaker in the room. The bathroom was very large, and the shower had plenty of hot water and really nice water pressure. My only complaint about the room was the lack of space to store clothing. There is a small area in the bathroom, but a chest of drawers in the living area would have been nice. We had to put our suitcase on the futon, and work out of them. This rendered the futon useless. OH well. No biggie. The views from the 4th flr rooms are fantastic! It was also nice to have the dipping pool and sundeck right at our disposal. My companion felt that the pool could have benefited from a chlorine treatment. He felt that it was a bit slimy, and that the shock treatment would have helped. The staff at the hotel was great. Check in and check out were a breeze. The staff was always helpful and friendly. Two individuals in particular stood out: Pablo at the front desk, who was helpful and accommodating with any request or issue that we had. And Abigail on the housekeeping staff was very sweet and very thorough, and her daily towel art was always something to look forward to. We had one breakfast at Illusion, but did not care for it. It is served in a cramped little room, and just was not very tasty. Instead we went to the Mosquito Beach buffet (just walk down to the beach and it's on your left). Although is was a little pricey (180 pesos), it was fabulous, with lot's of unusual choices of different foods, refreshing fruit waters, and a beachfront setting. We didn't utilize the beach club with whom the hotel has an arrangement, as we felt it was a little to pretentious for our tastes. Instead we walked the 1/2 block to the beach and turned right - walked 20 yards to the yellow chairs and spent our days there. Two chairs and an umbrella are 100 pesos, and they offer full beverage and food service. Quick, easy and cheap. All in all this was a really nice stay, and we will definitely be back. You really cant go wrong with Illusion, the location is perfect and the hotel strives to be the best that it can be. With a few minor tweaks, it could be almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and service...”
Reviews.Author: Starbritte
Reviews.Content: Started a bit slow as our room wasn't what we had confirmed prior to arriving. Staff were trying hard to accomodating us... next day we were moved 2 doors down. This hotel is very quaint and the towel art was amazing! I found the maids to be very thorough making this hotel really clean. Location is fantastic! Staff is great...would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning...ASAP”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: What a great place and value. Awesome young and warm staff, they can't do enough for you. Spacious rooms, extensive continental breakfast with fresh fruit included. (Try the huevos rancheros/salsa verde at least once-about $4 ala carte). The hotel attracts an eclectic clientele from the U.S., Europe, South and Central America, inland Mexico, making for interesting conversation and acquaintance. The concierge and staff are helpful beyond belief with suggesting and arranging day trips such as visiting amazing Mayan ruins, snorkeling/diving or making reservations at very popular restaurants such as our favorite, Como Como. The beach is a 30 second walk and the rooftop pool and lounges are delightful and convenient as well. The weather is fabulous, even on days where some rain is expected. Must not forget to credit the impeccable housekeeping, from the sweet lady who made up our room and created a new towel animal sculpture daily to the people who swept, washed, buffed the common floors. Great hotel, great town.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ewelinka87
Reviews.Content: Location. Breakfast included. Friendly staff. We were leaving very early and were told (the night before) that since we would be leaving before breakfast started that they could arrange to have some fruit for us to take. That morning there was no fruit and we had a very long bus ride ahead of us and no breakfast. I would have preffered for them to have told us they couldn't so we could have planned otherwise the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes2419
Reviews.Content: From the first moment checking in to checking out the staff was outstanding.They go the extra step to make sure you have the best and most relaxed stay. Karina and Mahatma made sure that out trips site seeing were fitted to us perfect. The Hotel is very clean and has a breath taking veiw of the ocean and Cozmel. We have so many great memories of our honeymoon. We can not say enough great things about this hotel and staff. We look forward to going back . Special thanks to Giuseppe

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Luzani
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, quiet, in the heart of Playa, nice staff

Reviews.Title: “In Illusion you meat tought reality”
Reviews.Author: tuncee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is somewhat different, more worn down than the pictures suggest. It was also not clear whether the hotel has beach - it has, but some 150 m walk from the entrance. We continously had problems with the air conditioning, and even when it functioned, it was too loud and had to be switched off for the night. We had twice problems with water - out of a sudden there was none (not even in the toilet). After complaining long, we got another room for the last two nights, next to the pool. The breakfast was also quite poor. The only positive thing was actually the kind guys at the reception, but when it came to discussions, they all moved responsibility towards the management. All in all, I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a bit more to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SEMkap
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a base room at the illusion for 5 nights in January. The room was very small, window with view to no where, beds and linens are of extremely low quality and very uncomfortable. Walls are thin and you can hear everything. Room comes with a safe, iron, hair dryer, free water and ac. The shower was pretty big. You will be forced to buy a voucher costing about $55 US for the minibar regardless of use. Internet is spotty and weak but could get signal in room, better in central locations. Chair in room was dirty and gross and there were small ants in the light switch outside the bathroom. Pool is small and not suitable for swimming. There are 8 chairs for tanning but the folks with rooms on this level seem to think its for their personal use and the area was often messy though a couple chairs were always available. As others have stated, hotel is very close to the beach right next to small convenience store and dive shop. Blue awning at entrance reads Experience and not Illusion, doors say both. While I would return to Playa, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Near beach quiet, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pscotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in between diving in Cozumel and the airport in Cancun. It is in a great location five minutes from the ADO bus station/ferry dock and right off 5th ave north which is the main pedestrian mall with restaurants etc, also a short half block from the beach. It is also near the nightclubs on Calle 12 if you want to go but not so close that the music bothers. Dive shops next door, can be in the water in 5 minutes. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super clean.”
Reviews.Author: Hankstefan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location between 5th and the beach. The staff and management were very helpful. We had an issue with our air conditioning our first night, the GM had us move into the room directly next door and was super helpful. We stayed a week and could not have been happier. We do not look for much in a hotel as long as it's super clean, and has a great location... The breakfast is simple and not impressive but nothing to complain about. There are so many great restaurants nearby there is no reason to eat at the hotel. I highly recommend illusion, and if there is one thing I would advise them to change is their signage. The Blue Awning marking the entrance says nothing about illusion or XPerience anywhere on it. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn-Fe
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The staff was friendly and courteous. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “we'll come again”
Reviews.Author: Rick W
Reviews.Content: I had three rooms for myself and my 20-something children. The location is fantastic. The rooms were good size, very clean, and secure. We felt immersed in a laid-back beach culture. 5th avenue is within 30m and the beach within 60m. The Concierge desk is manned by Mahatma and a colleague and gives receipts under the company name "Karma". We arranged airport pickup and two days of activities through Mahatma (the hotel put us in contact with him after I sent an email inquiring about airport pickup). No surprises and everything happened as advertised. Very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: MAH3488
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days and loved it. I have never stayed at a hotel with a staff like this. Every time we were even near an employee, they smiled and said, "hola" as if we were a long time friend of theirs. We never really had a problem but once the bottle of water on our floor was empty so i called the front desk and it was replaced very fast (they provide free bottled water!). Like other reviews have already said, the location is great. When finding the hotel, look for the blue awning that says "Xperience Hotels", it is the only name we could find. We flew into Cancun, took the ADO bus into town and only had to walk 4 blocks to the hotel. If you want to lay in the sun the 4th floor is great for that. The pool is small and cold, no one uses it. Plan on going to the beach, it is very close. The beach is huge and great for playing in the water. The hotel will give you tickets to a club on the beach for use of the lounger chairs for the day. The place just asks that you buy around $10 US from them worth of food during the day. We actually only did this once as we would just go to the beach to play and the 4th floor of the hotel to lay out. Our only complaint about the hotel is that the bed was hard. Unfortunately, most hotels in Mexico get their beds from the same place. We stayed at the Mayan Palace if feb and the beds were hard there too. We have stayed in Mexico several times and haven't found soft beds yet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Jed W
Reviews.Content: For adults who don't need amenities on site and are happy to venture a few metres for dining and entertainment, this is ideal. The white sandy beach is literally only 50 metres away. Similarly, 5th avenue, the pedestrianised main street in Playa, is 30 metres away. Restaurants, bars, cafes, shops, ATMs, watersports, beach clubs are all within 1 to 10 minute's walking distance. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. They will gladly arrange transportation and excursions for you. The roof-top terrace with its dipping pool is nice, note that this is correctly advertised as a dipping pool *not* a swimming pool, perfectly adequate if you prefer sea and surf. Breakfast is a simple cold buffet - cereals, toast, fruit, yoghurt, juice, coffee/tea - handy if you want to get out and about quickly. There is a diving centre next door, and the hotel gives you towels and vouchers for the many beach clubs, where you don't need to hire sunbeds/parasols provided you buy drinks etc. The hotel provides free spring water on each of the three floors and occasionally coffee in the lobby. It is hard to think of anything to complain about - if I had to pick something it would be the frequent running out of free coffee just when it was needed, no big deal at all. The noise level on the lowest bedroom storey if facing the street might be an issue for light sleepers on one or two occasions - pedestriams shouting rather than traffic. Not an issue for us as we were having such a great time we were exhausted by bedtime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, 1 block to beach, 1 block to restaurants, bars, shops. In the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: Love the location!! If your looking for a decent pool area, don't come here, can't even call this thing a pool. Also the room balconies leave a lot to be desired. Other than that this is a well run hotel: service was great, fully stocked and reasonably priced mini bar, clean, comfortable, and the air works (not so common in other playa/cancun location). Rooms are comfortable and big, even the bathrooms are a nice size. would stay here again for the location, would pay a lot more if they upgraded the hotel to be a little more modern. very safe location in mexico to walk to everything at any hour of the night. You don't have to cab it to the best playa has to offer if you stay here, unlike most of the nicer resorts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: so2080
Reviews.Content: Ask for rooms at the 4 the floor, where the balcony and little swimming pool is. Location is neer the beach and main street, but not noisy. Good for an average price hotel

Reviews.Title: “Adorable boutique hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Playa del Carmen and we couldn't have been more fortunate to stay at the Illusion Hotel. The location was perfect--10 steps from the beach and 1/2 block from the main street (Quinta Ave). The rooms are surprisingly large and spotless. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. An amazing value for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back .. for sure”
Reviews.Author: fabian_m
Reviews.Content: Excellent, nice and clean hotel near beach and 5th ave. The hotel staff always helped out with an excellent attitude. The price was very good considering the location between 5th ave and the beach.. it has a small pool up on the roof with a good view of the sea. Ask for Francisco to help you out on anything you need!

Reviews.Title: “This is a good hotel but not fancy. Service is great, rooms are fine.”
Reviews.Author: Pbergman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. It's not a fancy place but it does have AC and great service. We did not have the breakfast included but the rate was fair. I would suggest getting cheap eats on 10th Ave if you like tacos. Get off 5th to cut food costs in half.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at illusion boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxdeshikaxx
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time at illusion boutique hotel. Not only is it a really beautiful hotel the staff are amazing. We had a very stressful arrival due to the new york hurricanes. Vanessa at reservations made it so much easier to reorganise our trip. A special thankyou to Jorges and Raul for such outstanding service. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the money...”
Reviews.Author: Canyoubuymethat
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was very close to the beach. After reading the reviews I felt like I made a good decision, but there are some things the other reviews did not mention. First of all, the bed was extremely hard. It was like a concrete slab with a blanket over it. It's a good thing we wore ourselves out with all the walking around and snorkeling otherwise we would not be able to sleep at night. (I don't know if all the beds are like that) Also, this didn't really bother me but it is worth mentioning. There is no parking near the hotel. You have to park about 2 block west on 8th. Like I said, it wasn't really an issue, but when you first arrive it is pretty confusing because you are trying to find your hotel and you cannot drive anywhere near it. The cool thing about this hotel is the people are very friendly, they get you whatever you need and speak great English. The location of the hotel is PERFECT!!!! They give you beach towels and passes to the beach club. Also, they serve breakfast every morning, which is fruit, cereal, toast, juice. We stayed here 7 days and would do it again (only if we had a better bed).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Suuuusana
Reviews.Content: VERy close to beach! Perfect location!! Rooms are comfy ...got one with balcony...clean, for the price absolutely worth it! Met some people that checked out my hotel...they couldn't believe that I only paid 70 something dollars when they paid 50 something further away from beach and not as nice. Staff was so friendly and helpful...def. would stay there again...in fact, I already went back...was visiting belize and guatemala and coming back to playa for a couple more days b4 leaving mexico...booked at illusion :)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NellieBly1981
Reviews.Content: This was the best part of our trip to Mexico. Usually I like to rough it, but after horrible rain & mosquitoes at Sian Ka'an, some sort of awful burn on my bf's chest & oppressive heat in Tulum, PDC was great on just about all accounts. The staff id wonderful, the rooms are really clean & comfortable & so close to the beach without beach prices. Pay in US$ cash - they give a great rate! & for cash you get 5% discount. They give you a voucher to use on the beach for chairs. Hotel staff told me we had to spend $20 there but it appeared we did not. If you do go to Mosquito Beach & I do suggest it- very comfy & South Beach like, pay in US $$ as they really do give a very good rate as well. If you are driving, most likely the cops will not let you down the street to drop off your stuff. It didn't occur to me to give the jerk $20 MD. When we were leaving, the cop was really nice & let us through no problem. Also we parked on the street, checked with the police standing there- he said it'd be fine & the next morning it had been towed - but around the corner. It was most bizzare!

Reviews.Title: “Coudn't have been better!!”
Reviews.Author: Brazim01
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at Illusion Boutique during the busiest week of the year in Playa. We paid what was a very reasonable price for a hotel of this quality during such a busy time and we were amazed at the quality of service we received from moment we arrived. The desk staff were friendly attentive and quick to respond. The room (a free upgrade) was spacious and comfortable and had direct access to a large terrace and small pool with great views over the ocean. Residents at the Hotel get free access to Wicky's beach club which is a two minute walk away and is a fantastic location on the beach with great food and some good quality live music during the day. The thing that really made our stay in Playa was the quality of the staff at Illusion and as a result we have recomended the hotel to friends and will be paying another visit later in the year. If you're going to Playa then stay at Illusion, you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean & Close!”
Reviews.Author: migratialcoconut
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous when I booked because this was my first international travel experience, but the few questions I emailed before arrival were quickly answered and dissuade my fears. First off, the hotel is extremely close to the beach and right off of 5th Ave. My boyfriend and I walked barefoot the 1/2 block to the beach with our bag in hand almost every day. It was so nice to be right between the activity of 5th Ave and the beach, and the view from the 4th and 5th floors of the hotel are beautiful! Finding food was a snap; Illusion is right in the middle of the action, so we could easily access the "touristy" food, or take a 15 minute walk to the more authentic food joints. Walmart is a quick 4-block walk if you want to get any snacks. As for our room, it was simple, yet modern. There weren't any bells and whistles, but the room had A/C, satellite TV, minibar, room safe, hair dryer, and iron; all the necessities, but no frills. We heard absolutely no noise from 5th Ave at night, so there weren't any problems there. The best part for me was that everything was CLEAN (and by clean I mean spotless!). The housekeeping staff at Illusion is amazing - they put any American hotel that I've ever stayed in to shame! Everyone always offered a smile and they really take pride in their work. I found the hotel to be exactly what I was looking for too. Definitely "beachy" with white washed walls, Mayan artistic accents, and lots of flowers! Be forewarned that the pool is small and very shallow (2ft), but perfect for a quick dip to cool off or socialize. They also have loungers by the pool in case you don't want to walk over to the beach. Wi-Fi is free and worked in our room without a problem. The front desk staff was always very courteous and willing to help, but we were pretty independent and did not require any of their services so I can't comment on booking excursions through them. As for breakfast, I know a lot of people were disappointed, but I really didn't mind it. Every morning we had pan tostado and assorted Mexican bakery items, plus coffee and fresh orange juice. Again, it was simple, but it held me over so that I could pig out on lunch and dinner later! Overall, I was very, very satisfied with Illusion and would definitely come back if I ever visit Playa del Carmen again! This is the perfect hotel for the low-maintenance traveler, with just the right touches to make you comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful friendly staff cant wait to go back next year”
Reviews.Author: LeanneClyde
Reviews.Content: Stayed on level 3 (rooms start with 4) which has the sun bed outdoor area and wading pool to cool off. Rooms are great very clean and spacious and the staff are so helpful and friendly special mention to Day Manager Al, hotel is 4 doors from main beach and restaurants and shops sunbeds available on beach for use of Illusion guests. Fantastic location beautiful beaches and sunshine like paradise and we will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “You would not regret!”
Reviews.Author: houliganski
Reviews.Content: Illusion boutique hotel is a great place to stay. The front desk is very polite, friendly, helpful, and they speak excellent English. The rooms are very spacious and clean. We got a room with small balcony facing the street. Make sure that you check out the rooftop pool, it is a great place to chill out in the afternoon. Thank you for making out stay comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “A Happy and Convenient Place to be.”
Reviews.Author: belizeben
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel for its location, but found the staff friendly and competant. Smiles all around. It is very clean and has some interesting energy saving ideas. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value in a hotel....”
Reviews.Author: cpfoutz
Reviews.Content: My wife did it again...she found the best value in Playa when booking our hotel. I will say, the pictures may be a bit deceiving in that it looks like some were taken for a wedding...this is not a 5 star hotel. It's a simple hotel with simple rooms and in some spots it's a little dated and in others you can tell they saved some money. My wife and I do not intend to spend much time in our hotel or our room...we are there to see the city...and thus aim to find the best value. bottom line...in response to a negative review we saw...you don't get the Ritz for $100 a night. Positives: The normal evening front desk guy was GREAT...very friendly, always chit chatted with us when we left or came in and when we ran into him at the beach club. Gave some helpful advice along the way and all in all, made our stay more pleasant. Unfortunately I don't remember his name, but he is of some form of Spanish descent with a west coast accent. The cleaning crew did a good job of keeping the place clean. King size bed (in the value category...not always easy to come by) Nice shower (which is used often near a beach) Location was INCREDIBLE!!!! Some may like a location further north, but I felt we were steps from the nicest beaches and the 5th ave shopping district. There's a great store with anything you may need right around the corner. Right next to one of the better beach clubs in Playa...Wicky's....I had Exal hos my wife and I every day...very hard working man with a great attitude and a friendly spirit. Downsides: Small breakfast The common areas except for the check in area are very HOT!!!!! Some days I felt like I went from a comfortable room, walked through a hot common area, back to a comfortable reception area and outside...but I was already sweating from my short walk through the common area. They need to get some circulation going!!!!! Don't trust having a balcony b/c if it faces into the courtyard it will be too hot to use.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: EvaM79
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I stayed at Illusion Boutique Hotel four three nights and were pleasantly surprised. The location was amazing as we were steps from the beach, steps from 5th Avenue & few blocks from the ferry to Cozumel. The staff was amazing, our rooms were spotless and cleaned thoroughly daily and the morning coffee to die for. If you are looking for more of an upscale hotel, Mosquito Hotel is directly across from this hotel, but it will cost about $150 USD additional per night. We cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelleLundberg
Reviews.Content: What a perfect little hotel. Spotless clean spacious room. Great location between the beach and 5 th avenue. The breakfast, in the cosy restaurant downstairs, was simple but easy to upgrade. The front desk offered exceptional service and there were always room for some good advice on how to spend our days or just a smile and a chat. Overall a fantastic vacation - and we would love to stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay at Illusion, but their service was EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Zotsbest
Reviews.Content: We were actually next door and in Playa for our 25th Wedding Anniv. If not for the Solea Restaurant (part of Illusion Hotel), our stay would have been very disappointing. Dionicio went out of his way to make our anniversary dinner something to remember and HE SUCCEEDED. We had a very romantic candlelight dinner on the roof under the stars. The food, service and view were nothing short of SPECTACULAR. Our only disappointment is that we weren't actually staying at the Illusion Hotel. It is beautiful. We were able to view the rooms and they looked great. Thank you Kevin and Dionicio and the rest of the staff at the Solea Restaurant for making our trip so very special. It is truly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Everything great but the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SmokyMtnTravelers
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location/attractive/ nice rooms/priced right/a helpful front desk staff. The only down side is the continental "breakfast" that we skipped after the first morning. The orange juice is canned, the toast cold and the coffee undrinkable. Try one of the reasonably priced breakfasts on the street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: JimCapl
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Illusion---my significant other has been here several times---and it was wonderful. The staff tremendous and the management outstanding. Loved the location. The beach is just out the door and down the street in one direction and out the door in the other direction puts you in the heart of all the fun. You will not be disappointed. I hope to spend many many more days there. Soon would be nice!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here in June 2009 - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: bolting
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the staff and the location - quiet, close to the beach, but not on the beach. We easily became friends with the folks working there, and enjoyed the wading pool with view of the Carribean. The price was great - we had come to Playa with only one night booked, and spent all of our time at Illusion. Just couldn't imagine trying another place when we were so comfortable. I'll be traveling to PDC again this summer and hope to see familiar faces at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing front desk staff,God the best!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta61
Reviews.Content: we came back to Playa del Carmen and decided to visit the Hotel just to say Hi! somehow Al,part of the front desk staff convinced us to stay a couple of nights with a fascinating welcome and assistance. well,we overstayed 5 more nights with joy,comfort and got everything we wanted to do and experience!,incredibly professionals! not to mention everybody was nice and courteous! Thank you so much for everything,the rooms,the pool,totally a peaceful option!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel and the staff is the best”
Reviews.Author: IslandSeekerEva
Reviews.Content: I had such a great stay at this hotel over crazy New Years for 3 days. The front desk staff is the best I've encountered yet, they make you feel like family. The greeting at check-in made me feel right away like I chose the right place. The rooms were big and so comfy. Location was perfect and central to everything you could want. I loved strolling the streets at night as PDC is so lively. Yes the pool is small and shallow but enough since you have the ocean a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mani2ban
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights when we got to Playa for our first visit! It was at is appears in the photos. There is no view of the ocean, however it is only a few steps to the beach! Convenient location if you like walking on 5th Avenue. The hotel staff was very friendly and came to help us right away when we had any requests. Rooftop view is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “feel at home with the indulgence of hotel”
Reviews.Author: nosi28
Reviews.Content: in the road 8 in excellent location is a small boutique hotel beatutiful and quiet very quiet! 1 min from the sea 5 min from the party area! staff that make you feel as the only hotel guest!!! rooms are spacious and comfortable and very clean . simple pleasure! one of the best hotels where i was ! when i get back to mexico i know where i'll be back............

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Delfusilage
Reviews.Content: The illusion is situated between the main street and the beach, and couldn't be better located. We didn't hear any noise from our room. We stayed in a luxury ocean view room, which was clean, spacious and had sliding doors to the roof terrace and 'pool' area. Al and Isidro at reception were extremely friendly and eager to offer discount vouchers to local restaurants. We had some lovely meals at El Bistro, Pancho's backyard and Karen's is great for authentic Mexican food at a reasonable price. You can get an amazing range of margaritas at Wet Wendy's; we had a frozen margarita which was so massive it took us all night to get through! The Illusion gives you daily passes to the beach in front of Wickys, but you have to spend 100 pesos each on food or drink there, which is easy to do. Their burgers are legendary! They give you a choice of sunbed or parasol, which I thought was a bit weird, and if you want both you have to pay an extra 50 pesos. I dived with Dive Mikes next door and they were brilliant. If you are a diver you just have to dive in the Cenotes, they are out of this world. Make sure you take plenty of mosquito spray though as you will get eaten alive at the jungle cenotes.The ocean diving off Playa is pretty barren, so head to Cozumel where it's simply glorious. Our only complaint during our stay was the hotel arranged a trip to Chitzen Itza. I was told that it would in a minibus with a maximum of 12 people. We were indeed picked up (an hour late) by a minibus, but it took us to the outskirts of town where we were transferred to a coach, packed with 50 other people. Chitzen Itza was fabulous but the coach trip was a nightmare! It adds a couple of hours to the journey whilst you pick people up and drop them off to just about every hotel in the town. The only down side to this hotel is the breakfast. It is just a luke warm piece of toast, a miniture sweet pastry and jam, with tea or coffee. We asked if we could pay to upgrade to the American breakfast but they wouldn't let us. In the greater scheme of things this is a minor point, and you can easily get a decent meal elsewhere. We stayed 7 nights here and then went on to Cozumel for a week. We really wished we'd stayed in Playa longer. I'm sure we'll be back at some point, and it will definitely be to the Illusion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: phat99mama
Reviews.Content: Very basic, very clean, very safe. Great place to stay on a budget. Awesome awesome location just steps from the beautiful beach. We stayed in July 2009 but this review wouldn't let me put in that date... The roof top wading pool is fun to chill in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but watch for fake charges when you leave.”
Reviews.Author: oakdruid
Reviews.Content: Overall this was ok. The double rooms don't have balconies, and poor views. The hotel was clean. WATCH OUT FOR FAKE CHARGES AT THE END OF YOUR STAY. They said they were crediting me the deposit, (and pointed to Credito on the slip), but actually they were running a charge through. So if you don't read Spanish, BEWARE, as they will try to rip you off. I took it up with my credit card co., but they said I signed the slip so I was out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: Terridon
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Playa Del Carmen. Seventy feet off of Fifth Ave and 50 yards from the beach.It is located on 8 Calle Norte, just about the center of 5 th Ave which is a long pedesterian mall with shops and restaurants. Continental breakfast either street side or in a courtyard, rooftop terrace with small pool and great service especially at the front desk. Small enough for them to remember your name but large enough to handle a large group traveling together. We had a great week there. Illusions also belongs to Wickey's Beach Club one block away with free beach chairs, waiters on the beach and a great restaurant.Next door is Mike's Dive shop for those who like to dive or snorkle.If you rent a car you have to park on the street. We always found parking (free) within three blocks.If I was pressed to find something wrong it would only be the parking.A minor thing compared to the plusses of the location and the Hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jonno1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the end of June with my wife. Was pleasantly surprised with the room which was spacious, modern and clean if only but basic though. The manager and hotel staff really friendly and helpful. Stayed bed & breakfast which was ideal. Out of the hotel and 10 secsto the right was the beautiful beach and 5 secs out of hotel to the left was the main 5th Avenue which had restaurants, shops, bars, cafes etc and 4 min walk to the main clubs/bar area. Would recommend Wickys beach club with nice snacks beach beds and pool. Also for meals La Parilla, Karens and for light meals and drinks the Tequila Barrel all on 5th Avenue. Great hotel, great location, great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, friendly staff and nice roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Danielonthego
Reviews.Content: Located between the 5th (the happening street of Playa) and the beach, this small hotell offers big comfortable rooms, very friendly and clean, staff always helpful and attending any needs, we stayed there for 3 weeks without any issues. Just ask not to be placed in the rooms at the back corner if you are staying longer than a weekend. they have only one window facing a small patio. Rooms on the 4th floor are amazing with direct access to the pool and an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Per0606
Reviews.Content: First of all the "Illusion" have a great location, enough away from "la quinta" to have a good sleep and close enough for a short walk to the night life. Having the beautiful white beach just 50m away, is hard to beat. The hotel overall is beautifully decorated and leave you with a very personal feeling. The rooms have a clean and modern design. Coming back to the room every day after beach gave us the pleasure of a perfect cleaning and great suprise with the bath towel decoration. The staff at "Illussion" made our stay memorable with their warm, personal and professional way of serving us.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel & service. Excelent location..Very good price”
Reviews.Author: zen11
Reviews.Content: The Illusion hOTEL in PLAYA DEL CARMEN Is a hotelL you can call home while enjoying PLAYA DEL CARMEN,. ELEGENT rooms suites and bungalos. Exelent location for beach and town right in the middle of everythingyetsecure and quite. Staff are very helpful couteous and knowleagle about area. Wwould highly recomend and will stay at Illusion next time i visit the area. Dan from colorado usa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exactly what we were looking for, fantastic little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A100ac
Reviews.Content: We had read the various reviews on Trip Advisor before we selected this hotel. I have to tell you, we made a great choice. The Illusion is so well located, only 100 yards from the beach, and the same to 5th Avenue. We expected some noise, but there was very little to speak of, even though we had a balcony room overlooking the street. The staff were all so friendly and helpful about places to see and eat, and they could not do enough to help us enjoy our 2 weeks in Playa. The beach club recommended by the hotel was excellent, and we were really well looked after. The location of the hotel is great, with great bars on the beach with live music most nights, and a huge selection of bars and restuarants up on 5th Avenue or in many of the smaller streets just off it. The aircon was a blessing, and the room was very clean and well presented, and we would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta61
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience,from the beginning to the end. Unbelievable opportunity to feel Playa del Carmen with quality,comfort and style. Our rooms were just perfect!,Not to mention all the personalized attention from the staff was outstanding!,We were treated like kings up there,.Thank you Illusion Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience...again!”
Reviews.Author: mariacpro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Illusion Boutique Hotel November last year and loved the hospitality and quality of the hotel that we knew we would come back. This vacation we booked three rooms since it was another couple and some friends. We booked our rooms back in January and were pleased with the rooms provided and response to emails/questions we had before our arrival. Al, Isidro and Alex were wonderful and so helpful. We loved spending our time every day at Wicky's beach club just around the corner from the hotel. The hotel offers vouchers to the beach club as a guest of Illusion. The free continental breakfast was good and I highly recommend their chilaquiles. We plan to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect combination at the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bretta08
Reviews.Content: We found this boutique hotel through a package on orbitz, and had a friend who stayed here recommend it glowingly. Just 30 yards from the beach, and about the same from the main pedestrian walk along 5th ave, it provides the perfect location for everything in Playa. The hotel is clean, some of the rooms are a little small, but we upgraded to the top floor after hearing of some availabilities. I'd recommend getting a top floor room, as you have the sun deck and dipping pool right outside. The only down side to it is that you share this area with other guests, so there can be quite a bit of foot traffic. The pool is defintely just a dipping pool, but it was nice to relax in after sunning at the beach. The deck closes at 8 or 9, so after that you can enjoy the table and chairs outside your room. The complimentary breakfast in their garden courtyard is simple, but good. You can add on some cooked items like eggs and such for a small fee. We knew we weren't going to be right on the beach, so wasn't picky about the view, but our window didn't open and had a covering over it, so the first room we had was pretty dark. Ask at the front desk about discount coupons at some of the beach clubs (we loved Wicky's, just about 5 minutes walk along the beach) and restaurants. The staff was always very helpful with suggestions, and helped out when we had some trouble with our a/c. Johanna at the desk was delightful! We would absolutely plan on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay, and not long enough.”
Reviews.Author: Gams313
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed here, the first being June/July of '09 during our honeymoon. The rooms are an excellent value, always clean and quiet. The desk staff was always exceptional, recomending good places to eat and being Jonny on the spot with whatever we needed. I think the best part about this hidden jem is the location. 43 seconds after you walk out the door you are standing on one of the best beaches anywhere. What more could you want? We are already looking forward to the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice if you´re not in room #304”
Reviews.Author: XchocolateX
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fine, except for my room. I question the word "boutique", however. Somehow I picture a hotel that is 5 stars, rather than almost a 3 star. My room was very large with a king sized bed. There was a closet pole, a long shelf for a suitcase and 2 small drawers... in the bathroom! Since the small tv was on an etagere shelf next to the futon sofa, it could only be viewed from the bed; like looking at a postage stamp from across a room. There was an iron and an ironing board with 2 inch legs that was useless, as there was no desk, table or desk on which to use it. It wasn´t worth getting out of bed for the "continental" breakfast. Because, they are so ecology (or money) mind-ed, they turn the lights off at 11:00 PM making it difficult to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: scarket274
Reviews.Content: Illusion Boutique is 1/2 block from the beach and 1/2 block from 5th avenue. When we arrived, our window didn't lock. I called the desk and someone was up to fix it within 5 minutes. The rooms were large and very clean. The housekeepers left towels in different cute shapes and dlower petals on our bed daily - a touch we liked. The desk staff were very friendly and didn't mind answering our questions. My only complaint is that the king sized bed my sister and I shared was hard. Very hard. When you sit down, it didn't budge. After the first night though, we got used to it. In fact my bed seemed too soft when I got home. Other people have complained that the walls are thin. I agree with this, but it was not bad enough to use ear plugs except for Saturday night. There is a swimming pool on the roof but it is not very deep and closes at 7pm. Overall - excellent experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Friendly and Safe Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaLaLiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Illusion for a week by myself as my friends were staying in a different hotel. I loved everything about it!! Customer service was amazing!! I never felt nervous about being there alone and I love that it's an ecofriendly hotel. The view from the roof is awesome and even though it's just off 5th ave it's surprisingly quiet. The beach is just a few steps away from the front door and there is a little market right next door if you need bottled water or anything. I can't wait to stay at illusion next year!

Reviews.Title: “Totally loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dbluv2000
Reviews.Content: We just spent 9 days at this hotel and it was wonderful. Very comfy and clean. The staff was really nice. We were on the 4th floor, in a corner room. It was dark, but it really didn't bother me. You can easily go out to the roof top patio and enjoy the sun. The bed was comfortable. You can't beat the location. Just a half block from the best beach and a half block from 5th, but still very quiet. Wal-Mart is walking distance as well. I would say the only negative is that it when it rained, there was a constant dripping sound outside the window. It was very loud, it echoed. It would not have been a problem except that it rained 4 days in a row!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved the Illusion!”
Reviews.Author: MNhasSnow
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just spent April 8-15 at the Illusion Hotel and had a wonderful stay. The pictures on their web site were exactly what everything looked like. We paid for and received the standard room with no up-grade and were as pleased as can be with the quality of the room. We were also able to look into some of the other higher category rooms and they looked great. The fourth floor walk out rooms onto the pool terrace looked nice if you wanted something a little more special.The view from the roof on both the fourth and fifth floors was fantastic. Our booking included free continental breakfast at the adjacent restaurant (Scandic) which was just the right thing to start the day. Coffee, fresh OJ and toast and a pastry. When I say toast, I should clarify it was some kind of homemade bread (kind of like french bread) with strawberry preserves. Very nice. You pick up the coupon for the included continental breakfast at the front desk each morning. The location of the Illusion really can't be beat. Half a block off the beach and perfect for using the bus or the colectivo for day trips outside of PDC. The hotel also included the use of one computer on the main floor, which I didn't expect. Always a nice bonus to have e-mail contact with the family easily available. Our room was always cleaned before noon it seemed, and she did a great job with fun towel art every day. Staff greeted us as we would pass through the lobby through the course of the day. There is a little mini- mart just to the left of the Illusion and a money exchange with good rates just to the right. Very convenient. The Illusion does stock a mini fridge in the room which we didn't take advantage of as I didn't know the prices but it would be nice for some people. Also used the included safe in the room with no problems. One minor inconvenience (which worked out fine anyway) was that we only had one key to the room to share and also on that key ring is the key to the electricity so if I wanted to get up early and go for a walk I couldn't take a key with me as then my sister would not have electricity to get up and get ready while I'm out walking. The key for electricity was a new feature for me but it makes sense and really was only a minor inconvenience. Beach chairs were readily available on the beach for approx. 100-150 pesos for 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella. I look forward to spending my next vacation at the Illusion with my husband. My sister and I really just loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: ROCKGIRLCA
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Playa, close to beach and restaurants. Basic amenities but when in Playa you are not there to hang in your room. Rooms are very clean and the people at the front desk are wonderful. Great way to spend a week! Would definitely return ,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky83
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband went for Spring break, the receptionist Violeta was great, we had free cont breakfast EVERY morning and they had great tours for all the hot spots (Xcaret, Xel-Ha, Tulum), did I mention CHEAPER than the ones offered on 5th Ave. GREAT location between 5th ave which is "THE" walking strip in Playa and within 50feet from the beach. Maids were great left our room smelling fresh and more importantly left all our stuff right were we had left it. Not your expensive, over the top hotel liken the ones back home, it's small but comfortable and has a pool & bar on the 4th floor overseeing the ocean!! If I wanted to feel like I was back home I would have gone to one of the larger more commercial hotels, I LOVED the vacation feeling, mexican charm, and the way you feel hidden away on your own private island, thats how I felt staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress.”
Reviews.Author: Globehoppersdeux
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 3 nights.They gave us a room with a very small window and no view so we felt very cave like. Furnishishings were just okay (we had a kiki bar in our room as an entertainment unit) and there very little drawer and counter space which may be an issue if you are there for a week. The pictures of the pool are lovely but in reality, the pool is approx. 12 x 12 feet and only 2 feet deep. View from the roof/pool area is nice. They are working with the restaurant next door for bar service at the pool and room service. Location is great. A block from the beach and close to 5th. Our room was quiet at night which is important in Playa del Carmen. We felt that this place was a work in progress and that we would come back maybe next year to see how they have done.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay at Illusion”
Reviews.Author: PiaTDenmark
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank Johanna in particular for at very nice stay at Illusion. We stayed for 4 days to begin with in an inside room which was very moist and Johanna made sure that we got a room with an outside window when we returned to stay another 4 days before returning to DK. Very nice place and with a nice restaurant - Scandic - connected to the hotel and owned by a Danish guy. We will definately return to Illusion if we ever come back to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: tiarosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a group that was vacationing in Playa. We have been to Playa many times and found this to be one of the quietess hotels we've ever stayed at which is hard to come by in Playa, especially being close to 5th Ave (we had an inside room, without a balcony). The location can't be beat, 1/2 block to 5th & 1/2 block to the most beautiful beach! The room was nice size and had great wireless connection, the bathroom spacious. The little extras, towel art, clothes line in the shower, spotlessly cleaned rooms, continental breakfast, free beach towels, free beach club passes, and fridge in the room all made the stay very comfortable. There is a rooftop patio which has great views and a small pool (not big enough to swim, but fun bar stools in the pool to sit at). There is a litte grocery right outside the hotel which was easy to get most anything you needed and didn't have to make a trip to Wal-mart. Our group made the reservations early fall with Gustavo who answered all questions and emails promptly. All our rooms were available and even a few of us getting free upgrades from standard rooms. The staff, including Johanna, Violeta and Gustavo were great and available to offer any assistance. Our group was VERY satisfied with the hotel and plan to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value, totally recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Mordormex
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at Illusion, even before we got there, the staff was very helfpful and kind (Violeta, Joanna, Gustavo etc.). I was travelling with my wife and 3 year old girl for an 8 night stay and they were very nice with us and specially with my girl ( the cleaning lady made a different doll or figure with the towels for her every day, and everybody knew her name, gave her candies, etc.). The hotel is not trendy, but the rooms are spotless ( I didn't even saw a fly, spider, hair during all of my stay), the location is great ( 1/2 a block from bars, restaurants, a Burger king, Starbucks, 5 blocks away from Wal mart, and 1/2 block away from the beach)... and the staff is always ready to help, the beds might be a little hard , but i like them that way, the view of the ocean is great from balconies and from the roof. In other word I would totally stay there again and recommend it to my friends if they don't want to expend a lot of money, get great service and be in the center of the greatest beach in the world, Playa del Carmen....

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment-tried to bump us also...”
Reviews.Author: Jrudq
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time researching hotels and condos for our trip to PDC. We ended up needing two rooms and decided to splurge on the first half of our stay and be more economical on the last half. From the reviews and prices I was quoted, IBH seemed to fit the bill. $66 a night and a half block off of both 5th Avenue and the beach. Then I saw the emails about being bumped. So, I sent the third email to Gustav (I originally emailed to confirm they honor a GTA reservation, then confirming my paid reservation) to confirm for the second time that we had two rooms reserved. He replied as well as attached the confirmation on IBH stationary. We arrived to check in and as soon as the clerk said "just one moment" and left, I knew we were in trouble. Out comes Gustav to tell me that we only had one room and I would have to go to another hotel because my room was not vacated. When I starting pushing him and asking him why he would allow such a thing, he got very flustered and basically said there was nothing he could do. When I offered to take care of it myself, he blanched! I also told him about TA and what I have seen on it. Realizing I was at an impasse, I told him we would take the one room and I would wait for mine. That was acceptable. We were assigned a room on the second floor. One window facing the courtyard. Simple and clean. We messed around getting organized then decided to go have a cocktail (a recurring theme). I noticed on my way out an open door. When I looked in it was a empty clean room. As I looked further, just on the second floor mind you, there were two more clean empty rooms! So I marched down the desk, demanding to know why I hadn't gotten a room, and low and behold, here is a key and your room! Got my bags and moved in, another basic room, with a window overlooking some roof lines. We then proceeded to the roof deck where we met a group of folks who had the same exact experience. When they said they wouldn't move, they got a room... Needless to say, not a good start. Not a deal breaker though. The deal breaker was that evening about 11pm when a group of rather inebriated guests came home, were laughing, drinking, talking loudly and the whole courtyard basically reverberated with it. The fit and finsh around the doors is so poor that you see light in all directions. They are flimsy and whenever someone closes their door, it slams. Between the bed being as hard as a rock, hearing people and doors slamming, it was a tough sell for a good nights sleep. This continued to happen and finally on the third night, as I listened to a group who were sitting in the courtyard and being served by the resturant (oh ya, the clanking of dishes and glassware can be heard too), I called the front desk and complained. And I take something to sleep! I do know and accept that there are people who have stayed here and really had a good experience. I was not one of them. And it was all about the noise. Maybe the upper floors are not as bad, but I know I would never stay here again because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: leodicecco
Reviews.Content: If you can get a cheap Internet rate -I paid around US$ 60 for 2 pax- it's great value. It's located half a block from the beach and likewise from pedestrian 5th Avenue, right halfway through its length. The staff is very friendly and the facilities are spotlessly clean. The view from the roof is spectacular, though the pool is not so much for swimming as it is a cool spot to sit in and relax over a drink from the rooftop bar. Some rooms overlook the streets, others the central courtyard. On the 5th floor you get ocean view, as you do from one of the rooms on the 4th. The rest on the 4th have ample french windows right onto the terrace, which can limit your privacy inside if there are people hanging out there. My room was on the 4th floor, but in a corner. It was large with a king size bed, 29" TV, closet, minibar and coffee making equipment and supplies. I was protected from pool and deck users, which was good, but I had no view at all. The windows overlook a tube-like hole down to the first floor. As it was the top room there I could get natural light from the top opening of the hole. Probably similarly-located rooms on lower floors can get a bit dark. The drawback was you get noises from elevator equipment and water tank pump every time they are used, which at night can be a bit of a nuisance. Breakfast at "Scandic" restaurant next door -from same owners- leaves a lot to be desired. Service is slow and pretty bad, they always forget something, take too long and the food and coffee are not that great either. That's an off point. I strongly recommend it. Oh, you get fresh beach towels every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurel-Springs-Lodge
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience with a boutique hotel in Playa and we found it very nice. We found it on Trip Advisor and it had pretty good reviews so we thought we would give it a try. Rooms are very basic but also very clean, we did have a balcony room overlooking the street so we could see the beach on one end and 5th avenue on the other. Our patio door had a screen door so we did not need the air conditioning. It does get a bit loud at night when 5th avenue comes to life, but we enjoyed people watching from the balcony. They do have wireless internet but the signal is very low and slow, and usually not work from our room but did work from the sitting area in the hallway. Rooms did have small refrigerators, and we did have the continental breakfast which was fine. We had good service, this is not a 5 star resort but for a small boutique hotel it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “They ignored our paid reservation and bumped us!”
Reviews.Author: jkerrsd
Reviews.Content: We had a paid reservation and when wee arrived, tired and ready to settle in, they bumped us to a much lower quality hotel and inferior location. They did not adjust our bill. Don't book here, there is no promise you will get what you paid for. We met another family they also bumped!

Reviews.Title: “Promises not kept”
Reviews.Author: dpatchie
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews about this hotel that were good, I booked a week stay October 3 through October 10 2009. We arrived very late the evening of October 3. The town was very busy and it took us some time to get through the town and to convince the local police, who had the street to the hotel blocked off, that we needed to be able to drive down to the hotel and check in. Once we were checked in, we took our luggage to the room, found it hot, with no AC running. We went back to the front desk to ask about the air conditioning as well as parking for our car. We were told that we had to be in the room and use the key for the AC to work and "sometimes it takes a couple of hours to cool down". The clerk at the front desk tried to be accommodating, but the best he could ofer on parking was, to drive around and "find a place on the street" We went to our car and attempted to drive through the town to find a parking place. After an hour of very frustrating driving, we returned to the hotel, and told the desk clerk that there was no place to be found. He then said that there were some parking lots to pay for in town. We went up to the room and discussed the situation. My companion and I decided that this was not going to work for us, since I am somewhat handicapped and cannot walk long distances, and went back to the desk. We told the clerk that we would not be using the room, and returned our key. We asked how we would get our payment refunded since we had paid for the entire week, and he told us that it should not be a problem, but he could not do it, we would have to contact the hotel manager later in the week for the refund. We thanked him, and left the location I had originally purchased this through HSI and contacted them that eveining to let them know that the accommodations were unsuccessful. The contact was not returned in a prompt manner, but finally I was told that HSI had paid Illusions and I needed to get the refund from them. After arriving home I emailed Illusions and asked how to get our refund. I sent the original email October 19, and a follow up October 22 asking for a reply. I received an email on October 22 from Gustavo Hernandez, saying that they were looking into the situation. I heard nothing back, and I sent an inquiry November 23 asking for the status. Gustavo Hernandez replied back on November 24 saying that he believed the accounting department had processed a credit and to check my credit card statement. I replied back the same say (November 24) and said that I did not have a credit, and asking for information on when I would get the credit and what card it was being credited to. Since then I have emailed three times, with still no reply and no refund. I am very dissatisfied with the lack of communication and the fact that I paid for a week of accommodations, that were not able to be used. I will update this post if and when I receive a reply and a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Great location”
Reviews.Author: MotorCityWine
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 7 nights in Playa, and we were very pleased with this hotel. Upon arriving we were upgraded to a balcony room overlooking the street ( they did this without asking) and the process was painless except for the $50 deposit to cover mini-bar expenses. Not just a credit card on file, $50 rung up cash or credit($500 pesos). The room was roomy with a king bed, fridge, a/c, ceiling fan, tv and roomy bathroom. It was very clean. There was some street noise throughout the night, and noise within the hotel early in the morning, but that is to be expected and certainly tolerable. (you should travel with earplugs if noise bothers you anyways) The roof top pool is only 2 feet deep and rather chilly but that made it a perfect dunk pool for cooling off from the sun quickly. Although there was a bar on the roof, only one afternoon was there a bartender (he made a killer margarita) so we brought our own beers up there to enjoy while reading and looking out on the ocean. It is between 5th ave and the ocean on 8th st. This made it a perfect home base for my wife and I to go out walking around the whole city in search of food and drinks off the beaten path. We never had to take a cab anywhere. Breakfast was served in a lovely courtyard and was perfectly adequate. Coffee, orange juice, cinnamon roll and fresh toasted bread made by the restaurant owners mother. They did offer a full breakfast menu if you wished. Overall, we had a good experience with this hotel, staff was friendly, rooms and public spaces were very clean and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrGGothenburg
Reviews.Content: Ask for an inside room - no street noise at all, and very little other noise either. Nice continental breakfast (fresh baked bread and pastries) at Danish-owned cafe downstairs. Rooms very big, with a/c, ceiling fan, TV, fridge, shower room. Very friendly bi-lingual staff - nothing too much trouble. Spotlessly clean. VERY slight niggles - noisy fan in bathroom, slightly shabby towels. But that's nitpicking. This really is a superb budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clothes stolen - terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Mylegutierrez
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for our honey moon for 5 days. Everything went well until we gave them some clothes for laundry, we gave them 6 cloths and they gave us back 6 cloths BUT instead of my husbands new shirt they gave us a women underwear. We took it to the lobby, we where calmed thinking they just made a mistake... It passed 3 days and we never got the shirt back or any answer. We talked to the owner of the laundry and he said he never got the shirt, that he only got 5 clothes and that he didn't get the clothes the day we gave it to the hotel; he got them the day after. So our clothes where at the hotel for 1 day and anyone from the hotel could of stolen it. We don't know for sure if it was stolen at the hotel or if their laundry guy made a mistake and gave it to another client. We spent the last day of our "vacations" trying to get our shirt or the cost of the shirt back, but that never happened. The manager wasn't at the hotel that day and no one could help us. We even went to the laundry place to talk to the owner and he insisted that they never got the shirt... We lost a shirt, and a day of our honey moon, plus they made us very upset. I had to call the hotel almost everyday for a week and a half until the hotel finally accepted that the shirt was lost, but they told us they would pay us for the shirt but just half of the price. I told them that we didn't give them half of a shirt, that we wanted either the shirt or the full cost of the shirt. It took me another 2 days to get the answer I wanted and they made me spent more money on phone calls and more time. I would never recommend this place, plus their "restaurant" has terrible service, it took almost 25 minutes to get a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Tamster18
Reviews.Content: I felt a bit cheated by this hotel and the previous reviews i had read on Tripadvisor. Yes the hotel has a great location, but...the design of the hotel is awful. It is set around a courtyard, and unless you have a room overlooking the street or on top floor, you get a dark room with the feel of a bad British 1950's hotel with thin walls. Plus the courtyard design means that the sound reverberates .Breakfast was ok, and cleaning staff were fine. Desk staff were ok, but it was pot luck on who you got. We were travelling onto Belize and asked for help pinning down some information, but they were a bit clueless. Overpriced.Avoid unless the rooms are cheap as chips.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: NYCBegin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Illusion for seven nights over the holidays. It was well worth the money and we would definitely stay there again, and likely will if/when we return to Playa. Here are the pros and cons as we see them. Pros: 1. Cleanliness. The housekeeping staff was constantly cleaning, and we didn't see one bug the entire time we were there. They even cleaned the hair out of my wife's hairbrush - that's how thorough they are. Sand that we tracked in from the beach was gone the next day, the shower and bathroom were immaculate, and the bed was comfortable and big. 2. Service. The last hotel we stayed at prior to Illusion was a Four Seasons, and my wife and I commented a number of times that the service at Illusion was like a 3-star version of the Four Seasons. There aren't any of the five-star frills, but the staff was extremely nice and accommodating whenever we asked for anything. 3. Location. Illusion is less than a block from the amazing beach, and is right in the middle of downtown. I'd rather stay in this location in a very clean hotel than in an all-inclusive 10 miles away from the action. The location was perfect. 4. Restaurant. Though I don't think it's owned by the hotel, the restaurant adjacent to it was very good. All we ate there was breakfast, but the crepes and omelettes were first-rate. Cons: All things considered, these are very minor negatives, but they are negatives nonetheless. 1. Though it's very close to the beach, it's not ON the beach, and as such there aren't chairs and tables and those things that a couple other hotels have. However, you can easily go to those hotels and restaurants that do have seating on the beach - we spent many days at Fusion's restaurant/bar just a block or two away, and just sitting on the beach on towels. 2. The pool is not really a pool that one would swim in. It's very cold (in December at least) and very small. Sitting by the pool in chairs is all we used it for, but with a warm and swimmable ocean a block away, it wasn't an issue. 3. No fitness center. If you're looking for a workout, a morning run on the beach is your best bet. Overall, Illusion was a great hotel. Considering that the last vacation my wife and I took was a honeymoon with nothing but 5-star hotels, we expected to be disappointed by a relatively inexpensive hotel in Playa. We were not, however, disappointed at all. It's not a five-star hotel, so the bed - while comfortable - isn't top-of-the-line, the service is great but not omnipresent, and the TV isn't a high-tech plasma, but for this price range I don't think we possibly could have done better. Given the out-of-town location of most of the four- and five-star hotels in Playa, I honestly think we'd choose Illusion even if price were not part of the consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Illusion”
Reviews.Author: flyboy6554
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Worldlink Travel......a great deal, especially for the price. The hotel itself was great!! Located right off 5th street in Playa (the main drag). The room was nice, very clean....not luxurious but I didn't want to pay for luxurious. Had a nice bathroom and huge shower, good dependalbe air conditioning and the hotel was VERY quiet at night; great for sleeping. Only a block from the beach and close to many restaurants and dive shops. Nice continental breakfast every morning. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArunSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Playa del carmen for a week at this hotel. Its very close to the beach (but not on the beach) and almost on the 5th avenue. Its about 10 mins walk from the ADO bus stop and to the collectivo stand to tulum, akumal, cancun etc. The only gripe i have is that their wireless connection signal is very weak and i was never able to connect from the room, but it worked fine from the lobby. Also, their continental breakfast is just orange juice and a couple of breads everyday, so its better to have breakfast outside. Try El fogon opposite walmart, great and inexpensive mexican food. Also, if you're booking tours to chichen itza etc, try the Ruta maya tours on 2nd st between 10 and 15th aveune, they were consistently cheaper than other places on the 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, 30 seconds to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: MattSuzChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for our trip to Playa del Carmen! We had been to Playa once before and this time went with friends. The hotel was easy to walk to from the bus terminal and located literally 30 seconds walking to the beach and even less to Quinta avenue. Despite the closeness of the hotel to everything, it was extremely quiet and had a great tranquil courtyard and rooftop pool/bar. The hotel staff were incredibly wonderful and knew us well by the end of the trip. Loved the unlimited huge beach towels! We loved being able to sit on the beach, get some sun, have drinks, and transition very quickly to going out on the town in the evenings. The rooms were large with a minibar, fridge, iron, and hairdryer. The showers were huge and definitely great to jump into after beachtime. The beds were a bit firm, but softer than the typical beds we had encountered during our previous visit. The free continental breakfast consisted of coffee, OJ, and croissants/rolls. There is a great dive shop (Dive Mike) next to the hotel that we used to book our dive trip. Reasonable prices and really nice staff. We saw 4-5 bull sharks (unexpected) on our dive! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint with quality”
Reviews.Author: leelu77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice little place. The lobby was clean, air conditioned, pretty, and narrow. The atrium and hallways leading to the rooms is partly open air, but unique as there is beautiful vegetation growing up through the center of the hotel. There is a lounging area on the roof with a wading pool. (Most of the pics make it look bigger than it is, but it is nice for a relaxing dip or to sit on the in-pool stools.) The rooms were basically one large room with a bathroom (toilet and shower private with door, sink and vanity in room). There is a little balcony off the room, just enough room for two chairs. There is free internet access on one computer next to the lobby. It is right next door to a tiny 'convenience' store (cash only). Overall, the hotel was very nice and I would stay there again. If you keep in mind that it is a hotel, not a resort, then your expectations should be met. The staff was friendly and helpful. When we got our room, I noticed that the balcony door didn't latch properly. I informed the front desk and they apologized and gave us a new room without any hesitation, charge, or complaint. Both rooms were clean, the in-room safe and mini-fridge was nice to have. (You'll save $ if you just walk out the front door to buy drinks/snacks at the store rather than the ones offered in the room.) It is nice that it is close to 5th yet inside the room is quite. Finding the hotel if you're driving or taking the bus: You can't drive up to the door so you'll want to park as close to 8th as you can. They don't have their own parking area, so find one on the side streets. The bus station is not far from the hotel either, so just head down the pedestrian only street. It is located in the middle of the street (8th) on the south side between the beach and the pedestrian only street (5th).

Reviews.Title: “Great Memories”
Reviews.Author: powchop036
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Hotel is in the heart of Playa walking distance from everything. Staff is wonderful. Recommend to everyone. Made us feel like we lived in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hppytvlr
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had an awesome stay at the illusion. First, it's location is prime. It is extremely close in walking distance to the beach and all other locations of Playa del Carmen (ex. food, night life, shopping). Second, the staff is exceptionally friendly. By the second day, all staff knew us by name. They constantly asked if our needs were being met, and led us to great restaurants and stores. Third, the accomodations far exceeded my expectations. Breakfast was outstanding!!!! The pool is beautiful and has a beautiful view of the ocean and city. The rooms are a great size and they have wonderful spa services. I have already recommend this hotel to family and friends, and I am already planning a second trip to this city to stay at this same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Must Visit the illusion!!!”
Reviews.Author: j003
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel last minute before my trip to Playa and I couldn't have been more pleased. It is small and comforting, the rooms are gorgeous and the staff is very friendly. Definetely a place to go for personal service. No crazy overcrowded hotel feel ever. The hotel is located in the middle of playa's happening avenue and the ocean is a couple of steps away. My boyfriend and I are already planning our next visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alioshinka
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hotel i have stayed in my many visits to Mexico. Perfect location! Ocean views! Unbelievable staff and service. The rooms are beautiful, clean, and you really get the experience of a boutique hotel with personalized service. Definitely the hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great concierge”
Reviews.Author: Julia_12345
