Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, nice & neat. It is at a great location at the heart of Playa Del Carmen. I'm not really a night life person but in Playa Del Carmen, everyone is out having fun. After such a day, it is nice to walk back to the hotel. The concierge was great. He advised us great restrraunts to go. In some places, we even got a retreat once we gave his name. For the last day of our trip in Playa Del Carmen, the concierge arranged a day trip. The trip was well organized and cheap. The places we saw was great (dolhins, sea turtles, exotic birds and great place for snorkelling). I saw the best beach in my life. I have to say, it was better then all the professionals photograps of tropic beaches I've seen up to now.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you like being where the action is”
Reviews.Author: Moz09
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through a brilliant off'-season (and post swine flu) deal so value for money was excellent at $40 for deluxe room. That said, we did get a big clean room with king size bed, AC, fridge and microwave with ocean views on the pool deck level. The room was great and the pool area is a great retreat if the beach gets a bit hectic. Staff are really friendly and for us continental breakfast was included, which was a real bonus. Also there is free internet and wi-fi and books to borrow. Only warning is that the pool deck area and the top 2 floors in general can be a bit noisy as they tend to house people who are in Playa to party party party (and this week, us!). We were off season so there wasn´t too much to trouble us but I imagine it would be a lot worse in peak. The location is so great because it is 2 seconds from the beach, 2 seconds from the main strip and next door to a dive shop and a mini-market. Just be cautious of the 4th and 5th floor if you want a silent night.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuanPardo
Reviews.Content: Localized at the heart of Playa del Carmen, this hotel has a very good quality. Sometimes I felt as if I was in a 5 star hotel, specially when I was in the room. The swiming pool has an outstanding view. More than that, Illusion gives you free access to a private beach club...., very nice. Within the hotel, Internet service is a minor problem as it has no air conditioning. But just in front of Illussion there is a good internet service, phone call service etc with air conditioning. Previously, I tested several hotels in Playa near the 5th avenue, but this one looks to be the best. Carlos Pando, Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: vineyardkn
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa several times and stayed at all inclusive resorts several miles from downtown. We wanted to stay downtown this time and found this hotel on TripAdvisor. The price was perfect - and so was the location. I had read the reviews about the staff and how great they were - and man, were they right!! Everyone was SO nice and helpful. The great thing about this hotel was their affiliation with a beach club that was right down the beach from the hotel. I think we spent the majority of our time there. The food was fabulous...we even met the chef Francisco and he prepared several mouth-watering dinners for us. They not only had actual beds with umbrellas, but a swimming pool and nice bathrooms. The beach to the left and right of the beach club was rocky, but their stretch of the beach was perfect. The owners and wait staff were great and when we left, we felt like we were saying goodbye to friends. The trip was perfect and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value under on hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alfonsomoreno3
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was excellent. It was a few yards away from the beach, la 5a avenida (5th avenue), an authenthic mayan resturant, and much more. The staff was very friendly, especially Violeta. She was very helpful by making reservations to some of the activities Playa Del Carmen has to offer. She also helped us by arranging transportation to the airport at great price. I could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Amaizing!!!! Would Go Back Anytime!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fisch1978
Reviews.Content: great boutique hotel with a perfect, central location in the heart of playa del carmen. super close to the beach and amaizing atmosphere. would go back in a heartbeat!!!!! highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: anauribea
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for two full weeks in the Illusion Hotel and left with the greatest memories. I currently work in a hotel in Arizona therefore every time I go to a hotel; I observe everything and notice the smallest details. As I walked in, I became aware of the cleanliness of the marmol floors and mostly the big smile of Silvia (receptionist) and her coworkers. I as very impressed by their professionalism and knowledge, every question was answered clearly and most importantly honestly. I was please to also meet Jaime, Sales manager who even took time of his busy day to give me a tour of the property along with Ana - operations manager. The ENTIRE team took care of any requests from the day I walked in till the day I walked out. The hotel is located in a great spot clearly as the website describes – steps away from the main street (perfect if you want to be able to sleep) and beach. All restaurants are within minutes of walking as well as the beach beds they offer which are for FREE! I look forward for my next vacation in playa del Carmen and mostly to stay at the Illusion Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time , Great expirience of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: easy_travelerCancun
Reviews.Content: First of all this is my first time writting a review here at trip advisor and i decided to do so because i think the Illusion hotel is a great choice for a nice clean and great located hotel; this is the second time i stay here with my wife and never ghad a bad experience, i also think the young lady on the last review (second time around that i see this review) gher bad experience happen more than 9 months ago during high seasson (busiest of the year for all hotels) so i think she is really doing this out of Spite this is why i decided to wite my review; sure the illusion has areas to improve like any other hotel but the people working there are great (silviia, violet and isidro) on front desl are very kind and friendly and as far as the manager Mr Watson he was kind enough to take time of his day and say hi to us and everytime he saw us he made sure we were taken care off. this is why i simmit this review short and simple there is many great choices in playa and the Illusion is one of them ! great location the rooms are spacious and clean and is just a few steps away from the beach and form the 5ta ave. what moire caould you wish for, aT THE END OF THE DAY THERE IS ONLY ONE WAY TO FIND OUT AND THAT IS TO SEE IT FOR YOUR SELF!. WE WILL CERTANLY WILL GO BACK......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: unknown81
Reviews.Content: Jamie, Silvia and Violetta, what can I say... You guys were amazing! From the moment we stepped into the hotel door until the day we left, we were given nothing but respect, comfort, kindness and warmth. Your three are truly very knowledgeable people, who go far and beyond to make you feel comfortable. Sylvia and Violetta made the stay perfect, they had the answer to every question and concern we had plus more. The hotel is located less than a block from the beach and beach club which offers comfortable, cushiony sun beds with large sun umbrellas, warm and friendly customer service and great snacks. The hotel pool wasn’t what I had expected, a little small and more of a kid’s pool, but who needs a pool really when you are that close to white sandy beach and turquoise blue water! The roof top and patio had a gorgeous view of the ocean and the bright lights of Cozumel Island. I am so happy we decided to stay at Illusion, it was very clean and cozy, close to everything you’d ask for such as shopping, spas, great restaurants’ from casual to elegant, only a ten minute walk to the ferry which takes you to the island of Cozumel, which is absolutely beautiful, a must see! I really recommend people choose Illusion Boutique Hotel if travelling to Playa, the staff really knows how to make you feel #1. Jaime, you are a great manager, I am sure there isn’t a situation in the world that you couldn’t handle. I can’t wait to stay at Illusion again!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tchili
Reviews.Content: Well, this is the 11th time we have visited Playa having stayed before in all inclusives that we found very restrictive since you feel tied to the hotel to get the benefit of your meal plan. This time we took a chance from reading the reviews on TripAdvisor of the Illusion to try this type of hotel. I am so glad we did. We will choose to stay here again and again. I'm already trying to find a way to get back there for Christmas and then at least every six months. The hotel staff were the best. Violeta, Sylvia, Isidro, and another gentleman who worked nightshift (I apologize for not knowing his name) were wonderful. They made us feel right at home from the very beginning. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a balcony on the second floor and could see a little of 5th avenue and the ocean on the other side. When we shut the door, it was very quiet and peaceful. Our room was always comfortable and they refilled the frig every day. It was good not being tied to the hotel and found many fabulous places to explore and eat whenever we wanted. Karen's was one of my favorites. The beach club was only a short walk and they were very accommodating. The lounge "beds" on the beach were very comfortable. We fell asleep each day for a long "siesta" with a warm breeze and the ocean roaring in our ears. Couldn't ask for anything better. The hotel staff recommended places for us to go since we have been there many times. We had a great time on visiting Coba and X-Caret. Want everyone to know that the media has hyped the H1N1 flu thing to the extreme and there was no problem there. It really made me very sad to see the streets so bare and the people struggling to make it through the "crisis" which really is not a "crisis" at all. We love the town of Playa and the people, and have been going there for the last 18 years. Even through more hotels have sprung up, the people are still the most wonderful, caring and kind people in the world. They always make us feel right at home. Can't wait to go right back again. Hope the Illusion will have room for us at Christmas or right afterwards! Try it and see. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morocotopo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Illusion for 3 nights in late May of 2009. We were drawn to this hotel due to the location. We wanted to stay close to 5th Avenue but not on 5th ave due to noise concerns. This hotel is close to everything. The staff was friendly and our room was satisfactory and clean. The rooftop patio is a nice touch although the pool is more of a "kiddie pool" and very small in size. We will definitely stay again. Also, due to the swine flu, we did not get reservation instead opting to obtain walk up rates around Playa. We got this hotel with prices much lower than advertised. Also recommended due to the tienda next door that will provide you with cheap beer and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST PLACE IN PLAYA!!”
Reviews.Author: RockyJr
Reviews.Content: I just had the best vacation in Playa Del Carmen this month! My girlfriend & I spent 12 days at The Illusion Boutique Hotel & we couldnt have found anyone or anyplace better to stay! The staff is amazing, informative, trustworthy & courtious beyond belief. We were in Playa for the first time & we will be going back to the illusion shortly without a doupt! The hotel was clean, private, safe & located in the heart of Playa Del Carmen right on the beach! Close to shops, fabulous restaurants & of course the best beach real estate in town!! The roof top bar located next to the roof top pool mixed one of the best Pina Coladas around while giving a breathtaking view of the lush blue ocean & Cozumel island! Me and my lady spent night after night falling asleep while gazing up at the stars amazing! The night life in Playa is unbeatable, laid back & tons of fun! The illusion hotel offers the best cozy comfort that you just cant get anywere else!! Im from Vancouver BC & have travelled to Mexico many times. I highly recommend experiencing this amazing Illusion Boutique Hotel! Thanks Jaime for a great time see you again soon!! Rock

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit at the Illusion”
Reviews.Author: RiceLakers
Reviews.Content: We happen to vacation at the start of the h1n1 flu season. It was sad to see what impact the flu had on the local economy. We had called Jaime prior to the trip and he talked us into coming despite the h1n1 flu. Upon arrivial Jamie, Silvia and Violetta were excellant again. The Illusion is our favorite hotel. The hotel staff is great and they went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. No H1N1 in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to Play in Playa Del Carmen!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingWoof
Reviews.Content: Jamie, Silvia and Violetta are a trio that really set the hotel hospitality bar another level. From the moment we walked in the front door my girlfriend and I were greeted with incredible graciousness. Its the first time I was ever met at the door by a hotel manager (and as an airline pilot I have been to many hotels in my time) that took the time to welcome us to the hotel, enquire on how he and the staff may further meet any and needs or concerns and actually gave us our choice of rooms. Silvia and Violetta were wonderfully pleasant and knowledgeable and became a friendly smile behind the counter that you could goto for anything from towels to tourist info. Hotel Illusion Boutique (IBH) is located right in the pedestrian area of Playa Del Carmen (PDC) which it turns out was really an ideal location. Less than a half block to the beach front and surrounded by the heart of the PDC night life everything is in complete walking distance. We had friends staying in a very lavish 5 star resort 20 minutes north of PDC for a wedding and my girlfriend and I both resoundingly agree that our experience of PDC and our stay at IBH was far more enjoyable. The roof top pool and patio has a breath taking view of the beach and at night the city lights of island of Cozumel dance to the music of the local clubs not far below. Incidentally much of the beach front of PDC is furnished with cabanas and bars belonging to various establishments of which as guest members of the hotel you are entitled to free beach lounge chair and towel service at one of the beach bars (it was a nice touch, I thought) Finally as an side note I would be remiss if I did not comment on the state of the Swine Flu and its impact on our vacation. My girlfriend and I both had many reservations initially before traveling to Mexico. As I mentioned it was for the purpose of both a vacation and to attend a wedding of a very good friend. I can tell you from the experiences of myself, my girlfriend and those of the wedding party we are very, VERY happy we went. We decided almost not to go as a result of all the media attention Swine Flu was receiving. My girlfriend works in a hospital, myself at an airline, we consider ourselves to be reasonably intelligent and informed both from our professions and from a personal sense of accountability. Sadly buying into the half truths and hysteria of the media almost cancelled an otherwise perfect trip. I'm glad it didn't. I can only urge those contemplating a vacation in Mexico to do the research the facts and make a decision based on the full facts not the half truths that sell newspapers. I encourage you to visit websites like the WHO and CDC and look at the statistics that clearly show a higher seasonal mortality rate for the common flu, in Ontario, Canada alone, never mind nationally or globally than can be attributed to Swine Flu. Finally I encourage that armed with that knowledge still take precautions: get your flu shot, wash your hands often (and keep them away from your face), take a mask if it makes you feel better and buy some antibacterial hand spray. This should be pretty much standard practice at home or abroad regardless, but thats my opinion. If you decide to goto Mexico (which I strongly recommend, and even more so stay at the Illusion Boutique Hotel) go there knowing its SAFE, all the amenities were CLEAN and very friendly. Mexico and the Mayan Riveria is still an incredible travel destination that won't disappoint. I'd like to thank Jamie, Silva and Violetta especially and the rest of the IBH staff for their excellent service and making our stay in PDC one of the most memorable trips I've ever had. I will be staying there again as soon as I can and highly recommend the staff and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: juenbangs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Illusion Apr 23rd - 26th. It was our first visit to Playa del Carmen. We had a very pleasant experience during our stay. We stayed in a Luxury suite on the 4th floor. The room had direct access to the pool deck area. The first few nights we were there, only one other room on that floor was occupied. It felt like we had the entire place to ourselves. The luxury suite had a king size bed, futon couch, tv, and kitchenette which included a small sink, microwave and refrigerator. The refrigerator was stocked with items to be purchased from the hotel but we were able to fit a 6 pack of beer and water on the door without any trouble. The a/c will only work if the door is closed and the room key is required to turn it on . It only took a few minutes for the room to cool down once we returned from our journeys. We usually took a dip in the pool while we waited for the room to chill. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We had a problem with these teeny-tiny ants in our bathroom our last day staying there. I informed the front desk and they immediately came to our room to assess the problem. The front desk girl offered to move us to another room. Since it was our last night we didn't want to go to the trouble to pack up all our things and relocate. I asked if they had any bug spray. She said yes and asked if we would mind if they sprayed the bathroom. I told them I didn't care and they left can of bug spray with us. On a side note, I didn't really mind the ants. The hotel is situated a half block from the beach in an old building in Mexico. A few pesky ants in the bathroom didn't spoil our experience. The hotel is in a great location, just off 5th Ave. Walk in either direction and you'll find great shopping, restaurants and bars. For being so close to the nightlife, it was surprisingly quiet. There is a convenience store right next to the hotel. Great for beer, water, wine, sunscreen, etc. There is a money exchange on the other side of the hotel. We found it had the best exchange rate in the area. We didn't eat at the restaurant - we usually ended up eating somewhere on 5th. The bar next to the pool is only open during the busy season (not sure when that is but not while we were there). Probably a good thing..saved us some money. We grabbed beers from next door and took them out to the pool with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Sean_in_CO
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Illusion from Apr 19th-22nd and had an absolutely wonderful time. We booked the "honeymoon" room on the fifth floor of the hotel (call and ask Jamie about it, it's on the fifth floor (roof) by itself with tremendous views and space, a well kept secret not on their website) and I used this great setting to propose to my girlfriend at a private rooftop dinner with mariachis that was setup by Miguel, the concierge, and staff. Jamie was also nice enough to call me when I had questions about the room and booked my reservation over the phone. Miguel's big smile and friendly service was truly appreciated, and all the staff seemed friendly and helpful. This hotel is also centrally located in a great spot on Fifth with great beach access and passes to a nice beach club nearby. After experiencing the all-inclusive hotels in the past I was very happy to stay at a smaller hotel and experience more of the local food and flavor of Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: PlayaHaugesund
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days, and had a great stay. Clean room with better than average bed. A noisy air condition and some disturbing noise from guests coming home late at night did however not spoil the experience. Big plus for the cooperation with a nice club at the beach (free sunbeds and umbrella) and awailable fresh beach-towels from the front desk every day. Nice low prices for a hot breakfast in the resturant, and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: la61
Reviews.Content: It was my first time visiting Playa del Carmen and Illusion Boutique Hotel had the perfect location for mine interests, very close to maine street ( 5. avenue) and the beach, and a perfect place to have a base for excursions. The personel was very kindly and helpful. The rom was very clean. All over i was very happy with my stay at Illusion Boutique Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Want to see a filthy men's room???”
Reviews.Author: PlayaIsExellent
Reviews.Content: Go to Illusion Boutique Hotel and have breakfast at their "restaurant." Stale bread (toasted, but cold), silverware brought to the table in pieces (first, the spoon, then, the fork, then the knife - you get the picture). NOT ONE DAY WERE THERE PAPER TOWELS IN THE REST ROOMS! NOT ONCE! They ask you to discard your used toilet tissue in the trash can (so as not to clog the toilets), and then have a trash can FILLED with used toiler tissue in plain view. UGH!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Patbro
Reviews.Content: The location of Illusion is perfect - right between the main street and the beach. The hotel itself is extremely clean and well-kept. The price is reasonable for the area. There was always someone at the Front Desk, so we felt very secure, since there is just one entrance. Towels were always available for the pool and beach so we didn't have to use our room towels. Having a mini-mart next door is also very helpful for snacks and water, and there is a cambio just on the other side of the entrance. The only complaint we had was with the travel agent at the front desk. We asked her to check some transportation for us and she never got back to us. I don't know if the agent was part of the hotel or just an additional service. However, the front desk staff was most helpful when the travel agent failed to get our information, and they got it for us right away. This is our second stay at Illusion, and we look forward to staying there again next year during our Spring Break. Thanks for a great stay! We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: gustafa54
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Illusion Boutique Hotel from March 12-18 and am so happy we decided to stay here. The location is absolutely perfect. Set in the middle of the block it is just a few steps away from the beach and from 5th avenue. It is just 2 blocks over from the main street of clubs and bars as well. Hotel is quiet at night, so won't be woken up from music from clubs. The room was clean and fairly large. Only problem is there was no closet and it took a while to figure out the air conditioning, which would shut off whenever the balcony was opened or you left the room. But needless to stay, I would highly recommend this hotel. Only hotels which I would maybe consider staying at rather than the Illusion are Mosquito Beach of Alhambra which are right on the beach, so you don't have to pay for the chairs in front

Reviews.Title: “As great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BamaKevin
Reviews.Content: I read all the great reviews on trip advisor about Illusion. I was skeptical that everything would be as good as everyone said. It was really a great place to stay. My room was one of the fourth floor rooms that open to the pool area. It was large and comfortable with a great bed. I think the best rooms were 406,407 and 408. I can't speak for the other rooms as I did not see any of them but I suspect they are not nearly as nice as these rooms. Great staff, nice little breakfast, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: SnorkellingJeff
Reviews.Content: We split our week in Mexico between Akumal and Playa to experiment with an all inclusive vs a smaller room only option, and found this hotel using trip Advisor. It was excellent on all levels with rare cause for concern. Located 1 block from 5th, we were close to shopping. 1 block the other way put you on the beach! 3 blocks south and you could catch the bus to go to see mayan ruins and more. So location wise this was by far the best option. The room service was perfect, we left $5 tips every night and received wonderful towel creations in the am. We used a massage service as well, Rafa was great for getting the stress out of your body after a long day travelling. I would stay here again, but not for 4 nights - we would only do 1 or 2 nights in Playa. This was nothing to to with the hotel, but the fact Playa was very very busy and has a lot of pushy in your face vendors. Akumal was nothing like that, having quieter, better beaches and best snorkelling ever right out your front door. the only negative?? we ran into was the somewhat poor sound proofing of this entire hotel. Rooms are absolutely beautiful, but sounds travel through lightly built doors very readily across the all stone floors and the design of rooms around a central open area. Some nights we were able to hear several other rooms, and noise from outside even. it wasn't excessive, and wouldn't deter us from staying here again. We declined the front desk's persuasive options for a time share meeting (welcome kit was their wording), and in hindsight we are happy about it. The days are short, and there is a lot of awesome stuff to see and do. For food, we had affordable breakfast every day at Dona Diablo next door, and our preferred choice of restaurant was Karen's a couple of blocks away on 5th - where the best calamari around was to be found and excellent pizza. Madre Tierra was our favourite high end restaurant for tuna steak and filet. AVOID Agua Luna restaurant that the front desk recommends, it was AWFUL - we ordered a mahi mahi tuna steak and got what i think was grouper, or maybe some other type of normal fish covered in pineapple. Ordered fries, never got them. Paid $15 per drink. Never saw the waiter again after food was dropped off at our table (couldn't even eat it it tasted so bad), and when we went to pay they forced a tip on us still. Go to Karen's instead - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Pushy service, some slightly misleading information”
Reviews.Author: snewt
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were clean and the front desk was helpful, there was an extremely aggressive "concierge" who kept trying to get us to go attend a real estate event in exchange for a free trip snorkeling. Luckily, we had read in our guidebook about this nightmare and said No, but No was not enough for this woman. Every day she was trying to push us into this event, to the point it was uncomfortable to pick up our key to go to our room. The other 2 hotels in the Yucatan we stayed at were totally wonderful and I think this contributed to not being relaxed at all during our stay in Playa. Also, the "pool" looks like a pool in the images, but be warned it is about 4 times the size of a bathtub and goes to your waist. The free cocktail was in fact a free can of beer. So there was some exaggeration in the promotion. Also, the beach section allocated to this hotel was in front of rocks and not good for swimming, whereas others were not. Just something to look into when trying to figure out where to stay. One lock on our door was broken - I didn't feel unsafe because it was loud and lots going on in the area, but if that's important to you, then that's another strike against this hotel. Also, if you are renting a car there is no parking and this area is highly congested so can be an issue if you are coming into the area in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, great location, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jharringbone
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week-long stay at the Illusion Boutique. We were treated very nicely, and the staff was extremely accommodating. The location was perfect. Entry to Playa del Carmen's "famous" 5th Avenue was right at the corner, and we were able to walk to several wonderful restaurants. They have a private beach associated with the hotel. You had to walk a little way to get to it, but once there we had great service. They had a gentleman on staff who could make touring & activities suggestions. He guided us to go to the Dolphin Discovery Center to swim with the dolphins rather than do the one at X-Carte. It was a fantastic suggestion. There are several excursions they can make arrangements for right at the front desk. The rooms were very clean. There were a couple drawbacks, however. There was no ice machine in the hotel, nor were there any clocks in the rooms. In our room the air conditioner was over the sink area where I would be styling my hair. It kept blowing my hair out of place, so that was a little inconvenient. I don't think all the rooms have that same setup, so I won't generalize that it was a problem. All in all, we had a wonderful experience at the Illusion.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal & very clean, Minor issues”
Reviews.Author: refinboston
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here and both times I found the hotel to be very clean and a very good value compared to other hotels in the area. The hotel is in a great location and there is just a very good overall vibe here. My wife and I spent a week here and we didn't want to go home. The one thing I did find very troubling was the 2 days during the weekend that a woman was in the lobby pushing timeshare sales. She was extremelyy pushy and appeared to be working under the approval of the hotel as she was behind the main desk. Other than this one major annoyance the hotel is great and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay”
Reviews.Author: terryd78
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at illusions. We love location, close to the beach and 5th Ave. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was pretty and clean. We hope to stay there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return to the Illusion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CChurchill
Reviews.Content: Last November, I had the pleasure of staying at the Illusion hotel in PDC. The hotel was perfectly located one half block from the beach and one half block from Fifth Avenue, the main pedestrian thoroughfare that bisects PDC. I found the hotel to be charming, clean and professionally serviced by a friendly and welcoming staff. Since returning, I have eagerly told many friends and relatives of the wonderful time I had at the Illusion and PDC. I can't wait to return during the first week of March for a 12 day stay with my wife, sister and brother-in-law, and friends. Given the terrible economic times we are all experiencing, I can think of no better place to escape than PDC and the Illusion hotel. I would urge all my fellow travelers to do likewise ASAP. You will be very glad that you did. Jeffrey M. Riedl Pres. & Sr.Title Officer Midland Abstract, Inc.

Reviews.Title: “The Illusion hotel overbooks”
Reviews.Author: lizu
Reviews.Content: In early October 2008 we booked a "Deluxe Room with Balcony" at the Illusion Hotel for our Xmas vacation. Please note, that was almost 3 months in advance of the actual vacation. Since we booked the room through Orbitz, we paid 7 nights in full, on our credit card, the same day we made the reservation. Please note, room paid in full, high-season rate, almost 3 months in advance. When we arrived in December at the Illusion Hotel, after an 11-hour trip, *there was no room*. The Illusion Hotel management informed us they had "overbooked" the hotel, and walked us over to a larger, further out hotel we were not interested in, mentioning pseudo-perks we were also not interested in. I don't dispute the Illusion management's right to manage their hotel and reservations system as they see fit. I simply wish I'd known they practice overbooking. In which case we would have steered clear of Illusion and made a reservation at some other hotel which takes reservations more seriously.

Reviews.Title: “1o days in heaven!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Illusion for all 10 days of my trip to Playa with my boyfriend based on tripadvisor reviews and glad I did. I strolled past several of the other places I had considered and they definitely lacked the location, comfort, service and rooftop pool offered at Illusion. I was greeted by Cesar upon arrival , check in was easy, $50 deposit and away we were. Miguel works the desk at night and very helpful. We also took advantage of the $30 massages. I think everyone should be aware that the first week of January is a House music festival and you can definitely hear the street/club music depending on your location. Also, for first timers, there is a comfortable bus shuttle from the airport to playa for $9 per person. or you can take a shared van for $28 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice if you get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Travelbabe3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at the Illusion this holiday. I would say that under ideal circumstances I would give the hotel 4 stars but our experience makes it more of a 3. We booked and prepaid for a rooftop ocean view suite six months in advance only to find out they were overbooked and were placed in a much smaller room with no ocean view and a window that looked out onto a wall. After much pleading, we were finally put in the correct room on the third night of our vacation. We never received any compensation despite the significant difference in room cost. They manage their books still largely on paper so they are somewhat disorganized and had great difficulty determining which room would be available for switching and when. That said, here is what I see as the pros and cons of the hotel: Pros: location is fabulous to beach, shops, and restaurants; free wireless internet and free use of their desktop; friendly staff all around; the rooftop suites are large; rooftop deck, bar, and pool; free (although paltry) breakfast; cleanliness Cons: no dresser/drawers for storage in suite (only a pole and a few hangers); pool is small, shallow, and unheated; hotel is not disability accessible; only a few of the rooms that are considered “ocean view” suites really have decent ocean views (I recommend 406, 407, or 408); roof top suites may be considered too noisy and/or public for some (loud techno music from a neighboring club lasted until 6am one day). That said, we LOVED Playa Del Carmen and this hotel is a good choice as a home base, especially if you are not vacationing during their busy season, when the Illusion’s disorganization is most likely to show.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Esltchr
Reviews.Content: We are (sadly) home after a wonderful 5 days staying at the Illusion in PDC. For the price (we paid under $200 when we reserved in August) this small boutique hotel can't be beat. As others have said, the front desk staff are amazingly helpful and friendly (Gracias Isidro, Nora y Cesar!) The room was spacious and clean. We liked the coziness of this small hotel, with it 'outdoorsy,' open feeling. The location too is perfect: steps to the beach and Avenida Quinta. The convenience of free internet access from the lobby was a nice perk. The rooftop pool is small, but a perfect place to relax and have a drink at the end of a day of sightseeing. But the beach is the main reason to be there. For $10/day you can rent 2 comfy lounge chairs, a table & big umbrella at any of the beach clubs, which also offer food/beverage service. Only criticism: Very slow service at breakfast. Included continental breakfast is uninspired, but to their credit, they allowed us to substitute for other menu items. The young woman working there is very efficient; the older man & younger man seemed to be in "La-la-Land."

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Illusion Boutique!!!”
Reviews.Author: dizzyfingers
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Mayan Riviera 4 times and wish we had of stayed in Playa every time now. in previous trips we had spent a lot of time driving from Cancun to Playa Del Carmen which is much more family friendly and in my opinion has a much better atmosphere than Cancun. The staff at Illusion Boutique were wonderful! Polite, knowledgeable and helpful, Miguel went the extra mile to help us come up with cost effective ways to see different Mayan ruins. The hotel is small and although the town never sleeps and it was Christmas eve, we went to bed an didn't hear a thing! We were just a few steps from Quinta Avenida - the main pedestrian street and less than a block from the beach. It is a perfect location! The bus station is just down the street opposite the ferry terminal to Cozumel. There are so many things to do it appeals to many tastes. The hotel has a courtyard, small pool upstairs and small restaurant and friendly English speaking staff. There is good strong wireless internet throughout the whole hotel and it is free. The hotel offers the best exchange rate in town for its guests. Don't pay in dollars - you will be ripped off!!!! Get local money at the hotel front desk. I look forward to returning and would look anywhere else for a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Illusions Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Star9622
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing up a one week stay at Illusions. What a nice little hotel! The rooms were so clean and the location is great. Steps from the beach and 5th ave shopping! The staff were also very friendly and helpful especially Cesar on the day shift. They also all speak english which was very helpful. We would stay here again in a heart beat even though the beds are far too hard! At least the pillows were soft!

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of disillusionment”
Reviews.Author: John369
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for several nights. Was a bit of disappointment as I booked 4 nights online and the reality was quite far from the pictures provided on the website. Per se the hotel is not bad, however the drastic difference between the expextaions formed due to promsing pictures and enticing descriptions created a feeling of being ripped off. The pool on top of the hotel is no bigger than a large hot tub - that is very small for a pool. The breakfast included in the deal is edible, but you are better off eating in one of the restaurants on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: ppdl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very charming every onewas very kind and very helpful the hotel is very well located since 10 steps away from the beach and 5 steps from the main street... I had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: ashleylo
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time at a fair price. Miguel at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Overall, not quite as "luxury" as it claims to be, but certainly a good value stay with plenty of restaurants and clubs close to the hotel. Also, the beach was right down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bridger1303
Reviews.Content: For our week in the sun we used Orbitz to find and book lodgings in Playa del Carmen. Illusions Boutique Hotel was right in the center of action and the staff was friendly, welcoming and helpful. They made us feel at home and were great in assisting us to find alternative ways to visit Chichen Itza, Coba, and Tulum. One down side is that our room had the hardest (firm?) mattress in the hemisphere. Backache inducing hard.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Mexico”
Reviews.Author: spursley
Reviews.Content: Relatively small and wonderfully comfortable environment. Hotel rooms are large and very nice. We had balcony rooms which were nice but balcony is small. Look right and the water, left and the main drag for all the people, shops and resturants. The staff are wonderful and very helpful. All speak at least a little English and love you to practice your Spanish on them. For tours and where to go and not go, ask for Miguel. He is truely dedicated to making people happy and beams when you come back and tell him the tour was great. We had a problem on one tour and he made it right. Check with the hotel for when he is working as when we were there he got put on night shift, which is a shame since he is their best asset and should be working daytime. Eat breakfast in the hotel resturant and you will meet Alina and Antonio, twins aspiring to go to med school. Alina has the most fantastic smile to start your day. Don't get a rent car until you get there. Cancun airport rentals are a rip off as you will pay 20% or more than same car rented in Playa Del Carmen. Bargain with a taxi (best) or take the bus (cheaper). Rent at least a few days and look around. If you like the Mayan Ruins there are tours to all of them but most are easily accessible with a rent car. We enjoyed the stay so much we booked 10 days for next year. Oh yes lot of Europeans violate the Mexican topless law.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel Very Near The Beach”
Reviews.Author: Rashiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Illusion Boutique for our honeymoon. The hotel was nice and quiet and close to the beach. The staff was very friendly and the front desk personnel often helped us with Spanish phrases. We stayed in the Luxury Suite. The bed was large (a king) and very firm (which I like), but not uncomfortably firm. The shower was large too. Definitely large enough for two people to shower at once. The air conditioner worked well too, which was much needed. They also have a very neat system with the room key so that you don't waste electricity and cool air. They also had a computer in the lobby area with free internet if you needed it. The only one down side to our stay with a strange interaction with the staff about the fully stocked fridge. Since there is a Walmart very near by and since we planned on buying water and other food stuff ourselves, we wanted to use the fridge to hold things in. The fridge came insanely stocked full. Too full to put any of our things in there. So we removed all the sodas, water, and mini liquor bottles from the fridge to make room for our things because we did not want to pay whatever price they were charging to drink their provided refreshments. So one day we got a call from the front desk stating that because we were keeping their items outside of the fridge, we were going to have to be charged a daily fee for using the fridge. "Uh, what?" Needless to say, I talked this over with the woman and told her that I would not be paying such a fee. The next day, they had put all of their items back into the fridge and removed our items. We just left our waters outside of the fridge and drank our waters room temperature from then on. Other than that, everything was fine. I'd say, "We'd stay here again," but I doubt we'll return to Playa. We'll go somewhere new next time because it's more fun that way. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BossladyGreenBay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Illusion last week,which was our second stay at the hotel in the last 12 months. I would recommend a room with a balcony as they're quite large and get lots of sunshine. The pool and tanning area are on the rooftop as well as a bar which was open from noon to eight. The pool was quite cool, but great for cooling off. The continental breakfast was pretty lame this year .. coffee, juice, white bread for toast and croissants. We purchased a REAL breakfast at the restaurant a couple of mornings.(quite inexpensive) Breakfast last year was MUCH more superior. I'm hoping that the NEW manager will make a change and for the better!! The hotel has WIRELESS internet in all of the rooms (210 won't work) which is also one of the main reasons we stay here. Housekeeping does a great job in the rooms as well as throughout the hotel. Beach towels are available at the front desk and Miguel (front desk- evening) was extremely helpful and the best staff person at the hotel. Great recommendations for restaurants as well as things to do in the area. The hotel is incredibly convenient to the beach (100 yards away) as well as 5th Street ( 50 yards). The bus station is 8 blocks away so it's also very convenient to catch the bus to the Cancun airport ($80 pesos or $8.00 US approx). I've taken the bus both ways. It's an hour ride on the bus to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: hjalo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Miguel at the front desk was extremely helpful and very, very nice - the rest of the staff, not so much, but he made it worthwhile. If you're not going to do the all-inclusive deal, I'd recommend checking out this hotel. Very close to the beach, 5th Ave., etc. And, it's much more affordable that some of the other options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Illusion Hotel--great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: valann38
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Illusion Boutique through our vacation club. We did not know what to expect because we always stay at big resorts. The Illusion was a small Mexican hotel about 1/2 block from the Playa beach. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel and the staff. and the location!. The rooms were great and clean and opened out onto a huge balcony that was great for relaxing. The 4th floor had a beautifel pool that overlooked the ocean. The staff was responsive and attentive. The location was perfect with a short walk to the beach, a convenient store next door and a multitude of restaurants within easy walking distance. The location was everything as we could walk to anything we wanted to do. Chairs are available on the beach as are umbrellas. It was a fabulous vacation and we would stay at the Illusion again if we go back to Playa del Carmen. kipferva@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tangawizi74
Reviews.Content: We never stayed in a Boutique Hotel before and did not know what to expect. If all of them are like the Illusion Boutique Hotel in Playa del Carmen we will always choose this kind from now on! It is perfectly located just a few steps away from the beach as well as from 5th avenue. We had a big, quiet, very clean room with a very nice shower. Fresh beach towels are available at any time at the 24-hour reception. Front desk staff is very friendly and help you in any way they can. Especially Miguel saved our day when our tour pick-up did not show up. The only weak point is breakfast which could be improved greatly. Otherwise a very recommendable place to stay. Eveline & Tony (Switzerland)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajperki
Reviews.Content: I was overwhelmingly impressed by this hotel. In the best location, very cute, and the staff (especially Miguel) were great. When we go back to Playa we won't even consider staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “'Illusion' Exceeded Expectations In Every Respect !”
Reviews.Author: imrobertsheislinda
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor for endorsing the "Illusion Boutique Hotel" ! Exceptional value in terms of location...presentation...and service ! Miguel , Carina, & Raoull are the "consummate" hosts ! So genuine & accommodating to the extreme ! We have stayed at a number of so called "boutique" hotels worldwide that don't live up to their billing...but the "Illusion" is the real deal...exceptionally clean...wonderful maid service & just steps to the beach or all the action on fifth...we will definitely be back !

Reviews.Title: “a grand experience”
Reviews.Author: annon100
Reviews.Content: A very clean and comfortable hotel with an exceptional front manager who went above and beyond the expected. The hotel and staff personified the spirt of Old Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: akatine
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect. My mother in law booked the hotel for us. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. What a SUPER CUTE hotel. Miguel at the front desk was so wonderful and provided OUTSTANDING service. He was always helpful and pleasant. I LOVED our room. We did not have anything fancy it was a standard room but it was HUGE! The bathroom and shower were very big and roomy as well. The prices were very reasonable...especially since the hotel across the way was DOUBLE the money for the same thing...(less the fantastic service of course). Go stay there...talk to Miguel he will tell you where the best places to eat, sightsee and make arrangements for you. He confirmed our shuttle back to the airport without us having to ask. Now that is service!!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like Queens”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel and felt like royalty. It was so refreshing to be treated with such importance.....we were their special guests which seems to be the way that they treat all of their visitors

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Value”
Reviews.Author: steveandblondie
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 12 day stay at the illusion hotel. The hotel is quiet, peaceful and ideally located 1/2 block from the beach only a few steps from popular 5th avenue restaurants, bars, clubs and shopping. Our room, top floor terrace suite with swimming pool was awaome and provided a great view of the ocean and cozumel in the distance . Super clean and well maintained included a mini bar, air conditioning and large shower with plenty of hot water. The hotel staff was wonderful, friendly and extremely helpful and catered to any request. Also very pleasant helpful front desk staff with loads of information. Excellent restaurants, loads of shopping, great bars. We are looking forward to our stay at the illusion hotel again in the near future, Steve and Blondie

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Honeymoon Time! ! !”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMe21
Reviews.Content: This was a honeymoon and referred place to stay by my father who paid for our trip. Truly a great place! At night we (Steph and I) were able to view the ocean, with the reflection of the moon, and also hear the winds through the palm trees from the hurricane off in the distance (“Ike” – hit Texas pretty bad), but we were safe. Pool was right outside your sliding glass doors on the 4th floor – ASK FOR THE 4TH FLOOR! GREAT TIMES! Besides the hotel, we found it to be the perfect location...dive shop next door with nicest dive boat within 500ft...Trust us! When venturing off, Cozemel is only 25 minute away by ferry and only 5 minutes to a dive shop (# 2 dive place in the world - and cheaper). If your not diving, drive all the way around the island on a scooter. We have one great story…I will not share this one. Lastly, make sure to take a 4 hour walk...up and down the beach...both ways...cocktails, good-times...When checking into the "Illusions Boutique" ask for Miguel. He was the one that told us about this website and give our review! Regarding the hotel and its hospitality, just ask for Miguel and he will be able to guide you to a good time... Looking forward to being back, Ryan and Stephanie

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: peeweetlb
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, quiet hotel with an amazingly friendly staff! Mere steps from the beach. Wonderful and relaxing place!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: r0tterdamc0uple
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Very friendly staff, great ambiance and very clean rooms. Breakfast is mediocre, but there are many other options in the immediate surroundings. The bar has a great view, but (during our stay) it wasn't often open.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Small Hotel - Loved the Services”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFisherman
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just came back from a 5 nights vacation at Illusion Boutique Hotel at Playa del Carmen, Mexico. It is a small hotel, but is professionally managed by a group of friendly staff. Their services are remarkable. The hotel is very clean and decorated beautifully. We loved the services and the location of the hotel. It is close to everything. We enjoyed our stay there from August 25 to 30, 08. We had the massage services from the hotel on our 2nd day, and it was so good. We'd like to say a "BIG" thank you to Raul, Nelly and Miguel. You're so friendly and helpful. Again our special thanks to Raul & Nelly for helping us to follow up our trip to Chichen Itza on the 28th and our fishing trip on the 29th. You made our vacation a trip to remember! Thank you!! :) Overall I would say that it is probably the best small hotel we have ever stayed in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: barbiedurango
Reviews.Content: my family and i had a very good experience from this hotel, all the employees there, were very kind and diligent, they showed much interest in us, especially the manager, the room was really clean and comfortable, is a little hotel with a very intimate, calm, and nice ambience, it have an excellent service, a nice view at the roof, and excellent prices, i appreciate much my vacations there, and i am sure this hotel is my option always at playa del carmen, thanks, gabriela lopez leal, durango, mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Carmen's little gem”
Reviews.Author: smileamiga
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly Miguel and other staff working that day in a beautiful, air conditioned lobby. They showed us to our room on the rooftop, which had a gorgeous view of the Caribbean Sea and Cozumel. - Rooms - We were lucky and got the Master Suite, which I strongly recommend you trying to book (it's room number 401). The room had a king bed, a futon, a kitchenette (with a fridge, stove, etc), a dining table, TV, iPod speakers, and a large washroom. It was very clean, spacious, and the air conditioning kept it cool. We did not see a single insect in our room throughout our one week visit. It was excellent! - Food - There's also a restaurant located on the first floor of the hotel (Dona Diabla) where breakfast is served each morning. Although you get a complimentary breakfast (toast & orange juice/coffee), I recommend trying one of their $4 breakfasts. They have a wide variety of food for cheap, a great way to start the day. - Snacks - Beside the main entrance of the hotel is a mini convenience store, where you can buy drinks, snacks, alcohol, etc. Great place to run for a evening snack. - Internet - There is free wireless internet connection on the hotel rooftop and a computer in the lobby as well. But, I recommend bringing a laptop if you have one. It was nice sitting by the pool having a tequilla and being able to go online. - Location - The hotel is located in the heart of Playa del Carmen. It's approximately 30 steps from the beach and 20 steps from Avenida 5, the "strip" of Playa del Carmen. - Other tips - You can pick up towels from the front desk every morning before heading out to the beach and return them when you get back. That was a nice and convenient. In the evenings, Isidro (working at front desk) gave us suggestions as to where to eat and even gave us coupons for free drinks at various restaurants. If you want to go parasailing, talk to Miguel at the main lobby; he has the hook ups.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: cynrob
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a wonderful time staying at this very cute, well-appointed hotel a block from the beach in Playa del Carmen. The room was lovely, but what really stood out in our experience was the attentive and friendly staff who went the extra mile to make our stay pleasant. Breakfast on the roof (by the pool with a nice ocean view) was also great. I would recommend splurging on one of the rooms whose balconies step out onto that roof deck.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of Playa”
Reviews.Author: RAMFEB
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Playa, therefore, I was not familiar with any of the hotels listed on various websites. I chose Illusions based on their positive reviews. My plane was delayed six hours, making for one exhausted traveler. I was greeted by warm, welcoming, and smiling employees, Miguel and Isidro. I was shown to my room and was so very pleased. The room was extremely spacious and best of all spotless. My reservation was for three nights, and I was to head to Isla Mujeres for one week following my stay at Illusions. During my stay, I had the wonderful pleasure of meeting the rest of the staff. I can not say enough about them, ( Alicia, beautiful and caring, Axel) all provided quality customer service. The hotel itself has a surprise feature, an amazing top sun deck with a pool, and cabanas for a relaxing massage, again, spotless. My experience was so wonderful that when it was time to head to Isla Mujeres, it saddened me, but I had already paid for the accommodations in Isla Mujeres as a time share exhange) so off to Isla. Getting to Isla from Playa is not easy but I finally arrived and checked in. I had been at this time share in 2002, so I thought I knew what to expect. I was wrong, it certainly went down hill, grimy and less than clean. I checked out two hours later and headed back to Playa. After traveling most of the day, I finally reached the comfort of Illusions Hotel. Again, being welcomed with warm smiles. I spent another week at the Illusions in a room on the top floor, it was Heaven. This is the place to stay. The restaurant associated with the hotel is wonderful. The food is exceptional and the owner Nubia, (I am not sure how to spell it) is delightful. Her staff is friendly, and willing to make your dining experience pleasurable. I certainly recommend eating there. I give Illusions a GOLD STAR. Rita New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location between beach and Fifth Ave”
Reviews.Author: KittyGArnhem
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, very helpful staff (especially Miguel), who made our stay special and saved us quite a lot of bucks! There is no hotel more centrally located in Playa. I would recommend to have breakfast on the beach, though. Rooms are fully equipped, great airco and lovely furniture. Nice little pool on the roof with spectacular view over Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamKatia
Reviews.Content: Illusion hotel is a great place to stay! Perfect location. Next to Mike's Dive shop, you come out the door, on your left 10 steps to the main drag, 5th Avenue (but no noise pollution from it in the hotel), and 10 steps to the right you're on the beach (with all the facilities at hand). The rooms were great, the service too (room always spotlessly clean), and the people on reception go out of their way to make sure your stay is a memorable one! They were extremely helpful and we even booked our tours to the Mayan sites there. Thanks for everything, Miguel, Vladimir and Alicia!! And especially for taking my teenage son under your wing and taking him out a couple of evenings with your friends. That was such a great experience for him!! Breakfast is in a lovely little inner open air courtyard, the roof terrace with pool is great, always quiet, and also had a wonderful massage there. There is a small library where you can pick up a book or a magazine to read (and leave the ones you brought and read), and a computer for checking your email etc. Across the road is also an internet cafe with international telephone calling facilities. I would definately recommend Hotel Illusions to any of my friends planning a trip to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe one of the best kept secrets in Playa”
Reviews.Author: jermPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: Maybe one of the best kept secrets of Avenida 5. You can't beat being a half block from the beach, and a half block from the Avenida. Close to everything, but a pleasant and quiet getaway when you want to finish the evening off in peace soaking in the rooftop pool. Miguel, the concierge is a world-class host and will go out of his way to make sure your stay is an experience you won't forget. He is extremely knowledgeable and will gladly, promptly book any of your vacation needs. Miguel also just might be the funniest fellow you meet on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing staff (Miguel)”
Reviews.Author: PLavee
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, island decor in rooms that are clean, modern and updated. The location is fantastic, right next to the famed 5th avenue: restaurants, shopping and fun, and right next to the beach. The best trade-off between close beach and access to night fun. However, above all, we must praise Miguel. A colorful and fun character, very helpful and amazingly passionate in his service to the guests. Miguel is a key reason why we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReginaldtheGreat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 day stay at Illusion. We had a wonderful time. The top floor rooms are a great value with stunning views of the Carribean and Cozumel and access to the rooftop pool. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpteller
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Playa del Carmen, and the Illusion Botique Hotel was fabulous. It was about 1/2 block up from the beach, which was nice because it was really quiet! The hotel itself is very cute; the room was big enough, and the air conditioner was key! The staff at Illusion is very friendly and eager to help make your stay more comfortable. I reccommend this place as a great option while in Playa del Carmen. Close to restaurants, beach, mini mart, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaguar1120
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at Illusion hotel. The location is great 1/2 block from the beautiful beach and a few steps from 5th Avenue. More importantly the staff was great! Miguil and Dia at the reception desk were extremely pleasant and a pleasure to see everyday, they made sure the I had everything I needed. Jaquim and chef prepared and served a great breakfast. The rooms and hotel were impecably clean. The roof deck has a gorgeous view of the carribbean. Everything was taking care of. I'm looking forward to coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: terridvm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 13th wedding anniversary last month. We had some friends who recommended it, so this was our first choice, and we were not disappointed. I will say, go ahead and spend the money for one of the suites that open out onto the pool area. I had originally contracted for a "terrace room," and this room is pretty unremarkable. We asked for an upgrade, and they were very accommodating, putting us in a "master suite," which had a full-size refrigerator, stove, and dining room table. Definitely worth the money, since one day was very rainy and we had to stay in the room most of the day. The upgrade didn't cost anymore than it would have to book it online. Addtionally, the location of this hotel couldn't be better. We were just steps from the beach and very close to the Blue Parrot. This hotel is right in the middle of the "5th Avenue" district, so we were within walking distance of all the action! The staff was all very helpful and friendly. One thing to be aware of is that the pics on the website are not really current anymore. There is a lot of construction going on all around this hotel, and unfortunately much of the view of the ocean from the pool terrace is now obstructed. However, this doesn't detract enough from my experience to keep me from coming here again. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: antoine653
Reviews.Content: Originally we chose to stay at this hotel due to its great location in Playa del Carmen. It is situated a block away form the beach and is half a block away from quinta avenida, which is the main street in Playa. However we soon found out that there are many more reasons than location to choose this hotel. As soon as we arrived at the hotel the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They assisted us in everything from suggesting places to see and restaurants to eat at, to helping us arrange the best deal on tours. Miguel was the employee we had the most contact with, and he seemed to make it his goal to ensure that our vacation went perfectly. In fact, he personally went to a convenience store to get me some milk of magnesia when he saw how badly I was burned one day. One night there was construction going on in the middle of the night at the building next door to us and the staff immediately remedied the situation. They gave us a new room for the night and the next day offered to permanently switch our rooms in case the construction happened again. The cleanliness of the hotel was also excellent. The rooms were always well cleaned, and were a decent size as well considering that it is a fairly small hotel. One complaint I had about the rooms was that you needed to use your room key to use the electrical outlets in the room. So when you were not in the room there was no electricity, which meant that the air conditioning turns off as well. It was a little annoying always returning to a hot room, but the air conditioner worked wlell and cooled it off quickly. We spent quite a bit of time at the pool on the roof. Though shallow, it is a very nice pool and has an excellent view of the ocean. Great place to relax. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very kind and helpful, I will be their next year..”
Reviews.Author: EVITA78
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and kind, I want to give special thanks to Mr. Miguel and Isidro for all their help. The only thing that would of been perfect is if they would of had the bar by the pool open when we were in the hotel. If you like to stay in huge hotels this is not for you, this hotel is more for a get a way from all those crowded hotels. We were told that the bar by the pool opens in June. Overall, we had a great time staying in Illusion Boutique Hotel because we were close to the ocean and right in the heart of the parting. GRACIAS POR TODO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nat46
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great location (only about 2 secs from the beach). There is a basic convenience store next door and an internet place across the way. If you get up early it's a perfect place, with a nice breakfast. If like us, you like to sleep to noon it is a bit noisy in the morning and similarly the shower water is hot in the morning but otherwise lukewarm for the rest of the day. But the staff are extremely friendly and nice, especially Miguel at the front desk who was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “the centre of Player del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: sydneyaustralia9
Reviews.Content: the perfect location to enjoy Player del Carmen's beach and 5th Ave. Truly central positioning to all amentities available. Superb staff such as Miguel ensure the stay is pleasant and guests are well catered for with day trip organisation or local recommendations for eating, site seeing etc. Extremely affordable and enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Illusions and Playa”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler3141
Reviews.Content: Illusions' best qualities are its location - half block from a nice stretch of sandy beach - and its warm hospitality. This hotel was an easy stroll from the beach, where for about $6 per person we could rent beach chairs and umbrellas for the full day. The staff could not have been friendlier and someone was always available to offer advice on tours and activities. This hotel is small, clean and quiet, with all the amenities that we wanted for a short beach holiday. For a delicious upscale dinner, I also recommend the French bistro next door - La Palette. The duck confit is scrumptious.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziglivitbshtoonk
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Illusion and was very pleased with the hotel. The staff was very accomodating and very friendly, especially the evening Front Desk Manager, Miguel. He bent over backwards to ensure everything was in order for our stay. Our room was extremely large, it had two queen size beds and still had plenty of room left over. The major diappointment in the room was the lack of dresser facilities so that you could unpack your clothes. We had a closet type area but no drawers and so we were forced to live out of our suitcases while there. This was the major problem, not insurmountable to be sure. The continental breakfast was appreciated in the morning to get ourselves going for the day. As stated by others, the location is excellent, certainly staggering distance from most PDC bars. We did our share of staggering, too. Unfortunately while we were there it was low season so many of the facilities were not available like the roof top bar. The pool area was cute with a great view out to the ocean. Finally, we secured our room through an auction site so we especially felt we had a GREAT value, under $90 per night. I easily felt the rooms were worth at least $150/night given other places I have stayed in PDC (Luna Blue, Playa Maya, the old Contiental Plaza plus others). Overall, strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: justmyimput
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST hotel in Playa del Carmen!!! It is perfectly located - half a block from the beach and half a block to 5th Avenue, where all the shopping/dining is located. It is literally right in the middle of everything. You couldn't ask for a better place!!! All the staff members are the nicest people you can possibly find - they are genuinely nice!! Miguel was our favorite staff member - he is the sweetest guy! Miguel can give you any information about anything you would like to know and will always recommend the best places!!! Miguel was always willing to help and went above and beyond to make our trip pleasurable. The rooms were very clean and contained everything you could need. The pool on the roof is also really nice. Although it is shallow, it is perfect for wading and you have a nice view of the ocean as well. Continental breakfast is included in your stay and it was great and ready each morning for a vast amount of time depending on what time you would like to get up. The place was exactly what I was looking for on my honeymoon. For dining you definitely have to check out Mr. Kiwi's which is located on 10th Avenue (8th is cross street) which has the best tortas you are going to find in town. IIt is a whole in the wall but excellent. No kidding. Also, there is an excellent juice bar/restaurant on 5th Ave called cafe tropical. The food is great and the juices are even better. Also, make sure you take advantage of the cheap massages (about $35 for an hour). We loved Playa!! we will defenitely be back and stay at the Illusion!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: tripper61PA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an absolutley wonderful stay at the Illusion. (5/2-5/6/08) Both of us have been to Playa Del Carmen a few times in the past but have stayed at the larger, crowded "all-inclusive" resorts. We booked the Illusion on the internet. We originally had a Deluxe Balcony room (a very nice room ) but as soon as we saw the Luxury rooms on the roof-top we asked to be upgraded. Javier, our favorite staff member, got right on it. Before we knew it, we were unpacking our bags and sitting by the pool drinking Margaritas. Our room was just lovely. A king canopy bed with shear drapes, mini bar, fridge, and microwave. Each morning, we awoke to a lovely ocean view. It should be noted that the hotel did not want to move us to this room at first because the air-conditioning was not working properly and they didn't want to inconvenience us. We told them air-conditioning wasn't important and that the view and location were spectacular. Although we didn't care about the air-conditioning, Javier made certain the air-conditioner was fixed by 2pm that day! That pretty much sums up the treament we received. No request ever was ignored. By the way, we never found the music or construction to be an issue, as was commented in previous reviews. The location of this hotel is unbeatable. A few steps to the right is the ocean. A few steps to the left, 5th Ave. A Dive shop, mini market and money exchange are adjacent to the Hotel. I love the fact that this is not an all-inclusive, as we wanted try a variety of restaurants and not eat the same 5 ingredients re-arranged at breakfast, lunch and dinner in 5 different "themed" dinning rooms, as most all-inclusive's offer. Our favorite, by far, was "Babes" about 2 blocks away. Great thai food and drinks. VERY reasonable. Sit on the street and watch the crowds stroll by. Here is the best Tip of All!!! When you arrive at the Cancun Airport, walk past all of the cabs and private shuttles. They want to charge$60-80.00 each way to Playa Del Carmen. Continue to walk down the side walk to the "ADO" buses at the very end. You can not miss them. They leave regulary (don't believe the Cab drivers that tell you the bus just left and it will be hours before the next one). These are luxury, air-conditioned buses that go directly to Playa. The cost is $ 8.00 dollars per person and the trip takes about 45-50 min. There are also ADO buses that go to Akumal, Tulum and other destinations. The bus station in Playa is right on 5th ave so it is an easy 4 block walk to the Hotel. I could go on and on about the Illusion Hotel but I'm running out of space. Take my advice and just go there for your self. One small neg is that it's more of a quiet romantic boutique hotel and would be boring for small children. Older kids would love being able to walk down 5th and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: chrisandjackie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a balcony room, streetside...and couldn't have had a better experience. We have been visiting Playa for ten years, and this is by far the best hotel! Very clean rooms, very kind staff, and the best value in town. Miguel, at the front desk welcomed us with a huge smile.. sent us to off the beaten path restaurants, got us the cheapest cab to the airport, and sent us off with a genuine hug. This hotel literally offers you everything you could desire. Thank you Miguel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: JillManly
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed here in early April and really liked it. My husband, daughter and I had a luxury roon on the pool deck with a futon and king bed and found it very comfortable. Pool only good for cooling off but lovely sitting up there and looking out to sea while you have a drink. Noisy music some days though. Breakfast good, tell them to hold the oil if you dont like so much! Great location, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Once the construction across the road is finished it will be near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: PortenoBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 7 days honeymoon in Playa del Carmen at the Illusion Boutique Hotel. We got a Deluxe Balcony room, spacious and impeccably clean, we had a balcony with a view of the beach. The maids were very friendly and attentive, they made beautiful and different figures with the towels everyday. The bar on the roof was great but only opens from 1:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. and the pool is really small. About the breakfast service, they could improve the quality of the continental breakfast ( the pastries seemed old ) and the restaurant staff did nothing to improve the experience. The guys at the Front Desk made every effort to ensure we had a pleasant stay , especially Miguel, always with a smile and a suggestion to improve our holidays, from how to save on an excursion to the most incredible places some of them almost unknown to tourists, to suggestions for the best restaurants and bars in town . The location of the hotel is perfect , just steps from the beach and the allways festive Fifth Avenue with all the restaurants, bars, and shopping stores. We are looking forward to our next vacation at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Elaine_stuart
Reviews.Content: The Illusion Boutique Hotel is in a great location just off 5th. Nice and quiet, comfortable beds, very clean with a wonderful staff. At the reception desk Migel was very helpful and a bit of a jokester. Poolside and at breakfast you will find Javier. Have him fix you a drink and enjoy a good conversation with him. He's quite lively! Our room, 406, was up by the pool and overlooked the ocean. It was lovely and we would surely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: plaun
Reviews.Content: The Illusion Boutique Hotel was a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and very helpful. When we needed to book a tour and a taxi, they took care of everything. When we needed to reschedule our vacation, it was no problem. The room was perfect, the AC very cool, plenty of room for our clothes, a hair dryer and ironing board. We felt as if we were treasured guests! The gratis breakfast was very nice, with many breads to choose from, and coffee and orange juice. Nice, modern Mexican music. The location was oh, so convenient. Half a block from the beach, half a block from Avenue Quinta (the shopping, restaurant district). We would go back in a heartbeat!!!! Beautiful views from the rooftop pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CaboGirl
Reviews.Content: We were mostly pleased with our choice of this hotel. We (3 women late 20s/early 30s) stayed at the Illusion Boutique Hotel in April of 2008 and were in a Luxury Suite room with a king bed and a futon. The room had a king bed, futon, mini refrigerator, microwave, and sliders that opened up on to the rooftop patio area where the bar and the pool were; we loved this. The bar closed at 6 or 6:30, so there wasn’t noise issue at night. Note that the pool is really more of a wading pool – it’s about 2 ½ feet deep. Good for cooling off, but not for swimming. The pictures on the hotel website do a pretty good job of showing what the room looks like. The bed and futon were both very hard, but we were ok with that. As other reviewers have mentioned, by the end of the week, the bathroom did have a bit of a musty smell – probably from the wet bathing suits. There was no real closet in the room (there was hanging space in the bathroom), nor was there a good place to keep the suitcases. It did feel a bit crowded with 3 of us in there, but we didn’t spend that much time in the room. The staff at the hotel was very friendly – Javier is great; make sure you get Byron to show you his dance moves.
