The other guests staying at the hotel were also very friendly; it was a fun atmosphere. Because it is a relatively small hotel, there is the opportunity to get to know the other guests. The hotel offers massages in little cabana rooms on top of the hotel. The massages were very good and affordable ($40 for 50 minutes; $10 off if you book one within a day of arriving). You could still hear the music from the bar and the construction noise in the cabana rooms, so that was a bit distracting. Breakfast left a little to be desired. Toast and mediocre pastries were free. It was $5 a person to “upgrade” to include fruit, cereal, and a made to order omelet. They used too much oil in the pan so the eggs were really greasy. Most days we would eat elsewhere. We found a great little bagel/coffee shop on 5th avenue. The location of this hotel can’t be beat – it was steps to 5th avenue and to the beach, and there was a cheap internet café across the street. 5th avenue is a pedestrian street filled with bars and restaurants and lots of shops. We could walk everywhere from Illusion. The beach was great – crystal clear warm water, soft sand, and wait staff bringing you tropical drinks (try the Kaluha Kolada!). It was $5 a day to rent a beach chair. One negative is that there was quite a bit of construction going on across the street. We couldn’t hear it too much in the room, but it was annoying lying out on the rooftop deck by the pool. Some days they blasted music at the bar to try to cover it up, so it wasn’t exactly quiet and relaxing, if that’s what you’re after. You couldn’t hear the construction at the beach though, which is where we spent most of our time. Overall we really liked this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Illusion Boutique a Happy Retreat”
Reviews.Author: BostonToots
Reviews.Content: We loved our two weeks at Illusion Boutique. Everyone on the staff is so friendly and helpful, greeting us with a happy Hola! every morning when we left and every evening when we returned. Our room was spacious, clean and bright with a balcony that looked out at the sea. The beach was a few steps away from the hotel's front door. This is a happy, happy place with excellent service and I can't wait to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “I agree the staff was aloof...”
Reviews.Author: JCFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Illusion last year during the same week and had a great time. We got a great price and the location was perfect. We didn't hesitate to book it again. Last year I remember how awesome the staff was. They chatted with us during breakfast, gave us pointers and discount cards and always cheerfully greeted us when we entered or exited the hotel. This year was TOTALLY different. The location was stil perfect and the room was clean but I felt awkward even asking a simple question. At breakfast no one spoke to us and it was a struggle to get an omlet made. It just didn't have the same feel as last year. It goes to show you that the room cleanliness and location is important but what can make your trip is the staff. I'm not saying I wouldn't try it again and I would still recommend it if you get a good deal on the room. Next time we may actually try somewhere else. All it would take would be a simple cheerful greeting. In another review I saw that someone call the front desk staff "pod people" and I laughed because it did feel like that... like they just stared at you when you walked in or out of the hotel. Creepy... Maybe it was just an off week but it wasn't as fun as last year.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: ezola
Reviews.Content: The Illusion wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great. The staff, with the exception of the maids, was aloof. Nobody smiled at us, nobody offered to help us with anything. It was kind of weird. The roof was cool, but the bar closed early -- I think around 6 or 7. The pool is actually just a largish, knee-deep tub. Our room was spacious, but again, kind of weird. There was no blanket, just a sheet and rough coverlet. The window, which didn't open, faced an airshaft painted to look like a view. There was a mosquito net over our bed, which didn't heighten the romance at all and just made it more difficult to reach anything or watch tv. The door opened out and only cleared the bed by a few centimeters. Everything was just kind of off, like the whole place was a movie set and nothing was real and nothing worked when you actually tried to use it. The worst was the shower. Sometimes it was broiling, scalding hot, other times lukewarm, and you couldn't adjust the temperature -- the hot and cold knobs just turned the water on and off, and didn't even increase or decrease the flow, which maxed out at a slow dribble. And the water smelled like what I earnestly want to believe was sulphur. The maid service was excellent, and I'd like to reiterate that they were the only ones who didn't act like creepy pod people to us. They actually smiled and said "hola" and all that. They also provided excellent, prompt service. Our room was very clean. The proximity to the beach was great, but I have to wonder if there weren't better, friendlier, more comfortable hotels also within walking distance to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeB1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Illusion for 10 nights in March after booking through Expedia. It's situated between 5th Avenue (the main street) and the beach, both of which are literally footsteps away, so you have various shops and restaurants within easy reach as well as the sea. Our room was the cheapest available, which meant that the windows faced inwards into a shaft inside the hotel. No big deal, we didn't care about a view and there was plenty of light coming in. We enjoyed the mini bar and the little chocolates that we got every day or so. On the roof you will find a small dipping pool, a pool bar and various sun loungers. The pool is not big enough to swim in, it's really just to dunk yourself in when the sun gets too hot. With all the swimming area you could want just a few metres away on the beach, there's no need for anything else. We found the roof was a nice place to come if we felt like lazing in the sun but couldn't be bothered with the hustle and bustle of the beach (or paying for sun loungers). The basic (free) breakfast just includes fruit juice/hot drinks and toast. If you want to upgrade, you can pay US$5.50 to get access to fresh fruit, cereals, and eggs to your liking. The basic breakfast was adequate for getting you out of the door but I thought they could at least have given us the fruit for free. If you go for the upgraded breakfast (which I took advantage of several times), I recommend asking for "huevos rancheros" - a typical Mexican dish consisting of tortilla, beans, fried eggs, cheese and salsa. The only minor issue we had was that we found it difficult to keep the shower at a constant temperature. It seemed to have seizures of very hot and then cold. Not sure if that was just our shower or whether it was how the system worked over there. It wasn't a big enough hassle to mention to the staff. Overall we had a great stay at the Illusion, it did exactly what we wanted which was to serve as a central base for our activities around Playa and the rest of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Illusion”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a deluxe room at the Illusions and were quite pleased. The room was good size and very clean, although there was a musty smell in the dressing room/sink area (I guess it could have been from our clothes as it was the end of the trip). We loved sitting out on our balcony with its view of the water. Location couldn't be beat, and, even with its proximity to the restaurants/ shops, noise was never an issue during the night. And I'll concur with the other reviewers: Javier was a pleasure to meet and talk to.

Reviews.Title: “the best overall - location, rooms, price, service”
Reviews.Author: cormac55
Reviews.Content: Once again Illusion was great. Large room, clean, friendly caring employees. Good breakfast $5 or continental is free. Short on clothes storage and hard but somehow comfortable matress - but this is the norm for Mexico rooms. Watch your transactions in the handy but slick little store next door. Internet availability across the street. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Mexico, HATED hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelAbroad
Reviews.Content: If you're considering booking the "deluxe" room, save your money!!! Deluxe room at this hotel equates second class citizen treatment. The hotel is definitely an "illusion." Upon entering our room, my husband and I noticed we were given a room with two beds. We kindly brought this to the attention of Alena, who is charge of reservations, and she rudely replied, "that's a STANDARD room." She then showed us another room, which was under construction! Their website even states that a deluxe room comes with either a queen or king size bed, which is a total lie! There are NUMEROUS other hotels in the vicinity. We based our decision on feedback of others as well as their website. PLEASE save yourself the trouble if you're not considering reserving a "standard" room as Alena put it, which is their "deluxe" room. Perhaps others stayed at their "luxury" or "master suite" rooms. Our "deluxe" room came with urine stains on the sheets for close to $200/night. We didn't rate it "terrible" only for the fact that everyone else at the hotel was very helpful, and the hotel is very close to 5th Ave. Other than our horrible encounter at this hotel, Mexico is BEAUTIFUL!!! RENT a car!!! We went to XCaret, Tulum, Akumal, Cancun, Isla Mujeres, Coba, and Aktun Chen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Illusion”
Reviews.Author: playxtwo
Reviews.Content: Hello, my wife and I recently returned from a week in Playa Del Carmen.. We chose the illusion mainly because of the wonderful reviews that we have read here in the past.. We were NOT disappointed.. What a wonderful experience from top to bottom..The location of this hotel is fantastic.. Steps away from the beach and steps away from the Avenide DE Quinta.. Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay.. Especially you Javier!!! Oh and by the way say hello to RICKY MARTIN !!

Reviews.Title: “safe clean location location updated!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boatfun4
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. There is someone at the desk 24 hours a day to monitor who is entering the building. Roof top view is excellent. Javiar and all of the staff was wonderful. Just seconds from the beach and 5th avenue where the streets are full of safe and happy people. The owner has done a great job with this hotel. Would return to this nice place again. Mike and Sherri Cincinnati, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Illusion Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CamperfromND
Reviews.Content: Illusion is a great smaller property. We spent a week there in January 12-19.Very clean & well kept up.Nice but small pool on the roof good spot to cool off & enjoy a coctail from the friendly bartender (Javier) Excellent location on side street between 5th Ave & the beach. Everything you need is within a few feet of the front door.While not on the beach your room is probably closer to the beach than some of the large resorts that are on the beach. Shopping,Internet & a complete range of dining is available within a few feet of the Illusion. Very friendly & helpful staff. Only downside was our room window looked out onto the courtyard so we didn't really have an outside window. Try & get one of the front rooms that have a balcony to the street. Nice remote controlled air coditioning & an in room safe box. Also has a mini bar fridge. We were able to enjoy a very competive priced Massage in a rooftop bugalow.Room had a couch,hair dryer,ironing board with iron supplied in the room. We have been to Mexico over a dozen times & believe this is the cleanest hotel we have stayed in & one of the few times we haven't seen a single bug.

Reviews.Title: “In A Heart Beat”
Reviews.Author: quinsam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Playa del Carmen after a wonderful two week stay at the Illusion. The hotel is small enough that you quickly get to know the friendly and helpful hotel staff. We started our day with a yummy breakfast in the hotel courtyard. After trying a few other places in the area we discovered that we liked the quality and the price of the hotel's breakfast. We got to know and really appreciate Javier. He was the guy that served us our breakfast in the morning and pina coladas and beer around the pool on the rooftop for Happy Hour. When we left we felt that we had made a good friend and look forward to seeing him and his sweet wife Lucy on our return visit. The cleaning staff was mindful of the sign posted on our door. We slept in on several occasions and were not woken by the staff until we indicated that it was okay to do so. Our accomodations were very clean, the bed was large and comfortable unlike most that we have slept on in Mexico. We enjoyed our little balcony and would often sit on it after an evening on the town. We would read, listen to the ocean surf or tune in to the activity on 5th Avenue. When the door was closed and the air conditioner on we were able to sleep peacefully and soundly. The hotel is in an ideal location for heading off to sun bath at the beach, shopping on 5th Avenue or catching a bus to the visit the surrounding sights. There is an internet facility right across the street from the hotel and it was inexpensive to use. We look forward to our next vist to this delightful hotel. We are anxious to see more of the sights and activities that the area has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Illusion is Ideal”
Reviews.Author: dc2511
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Illusion in early November for a week. What a great value -- we were very happy with our choice! The hotel really could not have a better location, half a block to the heart of La Quinta or the beach in either direction, yet it feels private and is very quiet. Nice rooms (spacious for a hotel in this class), very clean, good bathrooms and beds not too hard. Would recommend this hotel for couples and adults as there are not a lot of extra amenities. The rooftop bar was not open when we were there, the pool is tiny, and the breakfast very basic, but none of these were important to us with the beach and a thousand bars and restaurants within a few minutes' walk. Overall the Illusion is comfortable, cozy and quiet at reasonable rates.The staff really put the Illusion over the top, however. Everyone is friendly and helpful, and they really went the extra mile for us when we needed assistance or a favor. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central base in the heart of 5th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixDiving
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Illusion Boutique hotel and loved every minute. The hotel is located 1/2 block off of 5th Avenue and is easy walking distance to all of the popular restaurants, bars, clubs, and shopping. Because it is not actually on 5th Avenue, however, it is a quiet and tranquil place to spend down time. It is also 1/2 block from the beach! The hotel is kept very clean and Javier and the rest of the staff works hard to make sure that all of your needs are met. We also enjoyed the breakfast every morning. The included continental breakfast consists of pastries and fruit juice and is great for a quick bite before heading out to area attractions. The hotel also has breakfast available for purchase that was very good and a good bargain. Overall it was a great place to stay and we will gladly stay here again on future trips to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “A lot for a little”
Reviews.Author: hittheball
Reviews.Content: I just retrurned from my trip to Mexico and stayed four nights at the Illusion. It is a little hotel with a lot to offer. Wireless internet access in the room. The room was clean and they always made little creations with the towels. The shower was big with plenty of water pressure. The room was spacious with an extra couch to rest on. It was nice to have breakfast every morning with free juice, coffee and toast. There is a rooftop pool that we did not go in, but it has a great view and could be fun. The beach is less than a block, Fifth avenue is a few steps away. There is a little convenience store next door. And finally, the staff was friendly and helpful. It was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly, great location, super clean”
Reviews.Author: evert321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quaint, the location is central to everything, but especially good because it is so close to the north side (more upscale) of 5th avenue, as well as the south side (more local, less expensive) side of 5th. Javier was very attentive. If you need internet and lots of amenities this is not for you. The rooms were super clean, the pool is very small, more of a wading pool but not needed because the beach is so close and the water is so nice to swim in. It's a great deal and it puts you near everything in Playa that you would want. I would stay there again. You get the benefit of being right on the beach next to very trendy hip hotels and can use their beach lounges (for a small fee or just an occasional drink) without the high prices of the actual beachfront. Its a great boutique hotel - meaning, it is quiet, warm, and friendly but if you only want to hang out at your hotel it's not for you. I was very pleasantly surprised by how I liked Playa more each day that I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timeey
Reviews.Content: Very clean and cosy little hotel in a very good location! Everything you need is close by(wall mart, little shops, restaurants, etc) and the staff is very helpfull and polite. i recommend it to everybody who wants to stay away from big mass all in hotels! Tip: ask a room on the 4th floor, the view is wonderfull! Tim en Nes from Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brendakiss
Reviews.Content: 1 week ago we have returned from the Illusion boutique hotel in Playa del Carmen, Cancun. The hotel has a great location between the beautiful beach and 5th avenue with his many restaurants and shops. So never a dull moment. The most of the hotel employees were really polite, nice and helpfull. The everyday cleaning in the room was perfect. No rushing at all. I really liked the decorating, that is really light and minimalistic. The last day we could keep our room longer for free. Our stay in the hotel was a really good one and I'll recommend to take a room with a balcony so you can enjoy the ocean view or look at fifth avenue with all his tourists and locals. But i'll have to say that the beds are way to hard. The first week I had some pains in my lower back. Furthermore, the pool was'nt always clean. But that may come from the rain. I'm looking forward for my next stay in Illusion, but only with a softer bed!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Playa”
Reviews.Author: KetronIslandgirl
Reviews.Content: Location,location... most central quiet place in town. 1/2 block between beach & 5th Ave. Steps from everything you need. Very quiet, very clean. Staff was very helpful & available. Great for couples, probably not good for families as not set-up for children, teens ok ! We would go back in a heart beat !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice clean room, unbeatable price!”
Reviews.Author: Hornet1455
Reviews.Content: We were delighted by our experience here! Room was clean, nicely furnished, and with a great view; only complaint was a hard mattress (which seems to be common in Mexico, given other reviews I've seen). Staff was polite, funny, and uber-helpful, including everyone from the reception desk to the maids to the breakfast cooks. Breakfast is available at a small extra charge, but you get a ton of food for the price. We would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Theo_Heselmans
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, the clean room, the friendly staff (tx Isidro). As breakfast is minimal, we had it at the beach (50m). Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cosy”
Reviews.Author: FromVeracruz
Reviews.Content: Its a great place to stay. But there is a problem, the breakfast is no so good, but that's all. I recomend this place if you don't have problems with the breakfast. It's near the beach and the ferry to Isla Mujeres. 20 mtr of 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Illusions!!!!!!!!!! Illusions Hotel is the REAL THING!”
Reviews.Author: Cachavacha
Reviews.Content: Just got back to Buenos Aires from Playa del Carmen, and I got to write the following: Staying at Illusions Hotel, was the best experience ever!!!!! The hotel is nice, clean, very well ubicated, and the STAFF is great! Everybody from Miguel the Manager, to Pedro the maintainence guy, Deyanira and Dorella the recepcionists, Alex in charge of the buffet , including the cleaning ladies, are nice and friendly. Always there for you to make things easy! During the Dean Hurracaine episode, Miguel was the greatest support! I don't know what I would have done if he wasn't there ... I defenitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for an unforgettable Playa del Carmen experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: noteasilyimpressed
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel does not recieve a perfect rating is that to us, a five star hotel has room service, laundry service, restaurant, etc. which this hotel does not. A five star hotel must also make its guests feel welcome, appreciated, and placed in surroundings more luxurious than their everyday life, and the Illusion delivers on all 3. We absolutely loved our stay. The staff was extremely friendly and (at the risk of sounding too much like a tourist) spoke english very well, which was very convenient. The room was spacious and comfortable (the bed was a bit hard, which seems to be a theme in this region of Mexico), and it was always cool when we got back, even with the air conditioning off. The balcony, which splits its view between the ocean and 5th ave was a luxury im glad i did not pass on since sitting out there at night with the breeze coming off of the ocean was one of the best parts of our trip. All in all we enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for luxury at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: joisagypsy
Reviews.Content: We "won" our stay at this hotel at an on-line auction, and our room was great. We got to stay in a room on the top floor, it was always clean, and our A/C didn't turn off when we left the room. The large suite next to us was not in use, so we sat in the little patio area there every night. It wasn't too crowded, so the pool was just right. Even our friend, who has lived in Playa for over 10 years liked the view from the top floor! The staff was so friendly and nice, from the front desk to the general manager! We had a fridge in our room, and they let us put our stuff in with minimal extra charge.They scheduled my massage, which is a great deal, and Pedro was fantastic!! We go to Playa every year, and this hotel is in a great location. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: rrogersiii
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff here were SO friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent (and cheap) -- a better deal than any other restaurant around. Our room was spotless -- the only minor complaint would be the door to our room -- it felt a little thin and cheap (the lock was also a little wobbly). However, the hotel overall felt so safe that this wasn't a real concern. Finally, the pool on the roof (with its fabulous view) was a great place to recover from our long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: casual_traveler86
Reviews.Content: I’ll state the negatives first: The hotel is not adults-only despite advertising that they are. If that is important to you, do not stay here. When we asked, the staff told us that during low-season they will sell rooms to families to try and fill the hotel. I can only assume the same thing would apply all year. Second, the “pool” is only 2.5 feet deep and so small that more than 6 is a crowd; a complete disappointment. Although, it is hard to find a pool in this price range at all. On the upside, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were a descent size, clean, and had all the modern conveniences. The location was fantastic – just a block to the beach, shopping, restaurants and only 10 short blocks from the pier to catch the ferry to Cozumel. The deluxe “balcony” room is fairly worthless though as the balcony is big enough to just stand on, but is not for sitting out. The air conditioning did turn off when you leave as others have stated, but the room cooled back down in a few minutes. Overall, it was a good hotel for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “No bueno por nada”
Reviews.Author: ATXTravelingHornsFan
Reviews.Content: This place was very disappointing. The location was great, but the rooms were dirty and the beds were hard. The key that turns your room's electricity on and off is attached to the room key, so that when you leave your room you have to turn the electricity, and the air conditioner, off. So everytime you come back to your room, it is hot. There was hair in my daughters' bed, and when they brought "clean" sheets, they had hair and boogers in them. I suppose if you were going to Playa just to party and didn't care how gross your room was, this is okay. It is a block off 5th Avenue and real convenient. But if you are going thinking that it is a romantic getaway or a neat place for family - forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kstenger
Reviews.Content: After an especially bad experience at another resort, we transferred to Illusion Boutique Hotel which ultimately turned a very unhappy, negative experience into a positive one. The hotel's General Manager treated us so well; each time we left or returned to our room, he greeted us with a smile and made sure we were happy and enjoying our stay. After my bank became concerned that someone had stolen my debit card and frozen our account, he offered to come pick up the tab if we were stranded at a restaurant again. There isn't a restaurant in the hotel, but they do offer a continental breakfast (included) or eggs made to order (not included) in the courtyard each morning. The two gentlemen operating the breakfast were also incredibly friendly. We stayed in a Luxury Suite and it was not huge, but perfectly adequate for our needs. One interesting thing about the rooms are the lights and air conditioning are operated by a key, meaning, you have to insert a key to power them up, and if the door is ajar or the key is removed, you lose power. We thought we would try to outsmart the system by removing the light key from the room keyring and leave it in the room at all times - try again...the keyring was welded closed. We asked for a second set of room keys (again, we thought we were so clever), and were told that if we ever needed to get into the room to just ask the front desk and they would let us in. This wasn't a huge deal, but it did mean that once you leave your room, unless you want to leave your room unlocked, the A/C wasn't cooling your room. Fortunately, the A/C units were excellent and our room was always cooled down within a matter of a few minutes. I can't say enough nice things about the staff at this hotel, in fact, our last night in Mexico, the staff held a private party for the owner of the hotel and invited us to join them, telling us we were "family". The hotel is located right in the heart of 5th Avenue - we simply walked out the door and were exactly where we needed to be. The ferry to Cozumel is also just a few blocks away, and we made the trip over on a number of occasions. There is also an internet cafe right across the street that charges $15 Pesos an hour for broadband, which was incredibly convenient and at about $1.50 an hour U.S., very reasonably priced. The dive shop right next to the hotel is also very reasonable, about $16 a person / per day for snorkeling gear. Again, when we arrived at Illusion, we were in fairly cranky moods due to our unfortunate experience at the other hotel, and the staff at Illusion, as well as a great overall experience, saved our honeymoon. Thank you, Illusion! We would definitely stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: CaroB100
Reviews.Content: The staff make this hotel. Everyone is incredibly friendly and helpful. The location is also excellent - really close to the beach and also to all the shops, bars and restaurants. This can sometimes make a place noisy, but we didn't find this with our room (ocean view room on 3rd floor). The hotel doesn't have its own beach club but has an arrangement with the nearest, where as long as you buy drinks over a certain amount (100 pesos I think) the beds are free. However there's a better one next door at the Mosquito Beach Hotel with big comfy black day beds, deck chairs and sun beds with shades over your face. To spend the day here costs 120 pesos for 2 people. A quick scout up the beach didn't reveal anywhere nicer, so the Illusion is in a good spot. (However the beach at Mamita's Beach Club 15 - 20 minutes walk away is even nicer. Very funky and fun for people watching on a weekend). Rooms at the Illusion are as recent reviewers describe - clean and comfortable rather than luxurious. Would have no hesitation in staying here if we return to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “It's the best Illusion I've seen!”
Reviews.Author: 4vacationists
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you, I've been to Mexico many times and there has never been a better bunch of people than you'll find at the Illusion. The accomodations and service you will get from the Illusion are 5-Star and of the best value I've ever experienced in Mexico. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and have done so, many times. This was my 2nd time at the Illusion and I'll never stay anywhere else. Since our last stay the hotel has improved in many ways and they seem to be only making the accomodations more impressive. If you like being catered to and love value, the Illusion is the best Hotel in Playa. I would recommend the 3rd floor, the ocean view is breath-taking. I would give the Illusion 2 BIG thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure to stay at Illusion!”
Reviews.Author: saratraveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into Hotel Illusion, the staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasurable. The staff was amazing -- they provided first rate service! Everything from restaurant reservations to local attraction advice was given, always with a smile. We truly felt like valued guests. The rooms are unique and spacious, but not overly posh. We especially enjoyed the iPod stereo with alarm in each room, as we were able to listen to our music at anytime. Another great amenity was the wireless Internet service throughout the hotel. It was great to be connected while away from home! The location near the beach and 5th Avenue shopping was unbeatable! You can literally be at the beach in seconds and if you don't feel like venturing out, the rooftop deck with a view of the Caribbean is remarkable. If you really want to experience Playa del Carmen, do NOT stay in a resort outside of the city limits. Be a guest at Hotel Illusion! Their customer service, amenities and reasonable prices will make you glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great rooms, great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelici0us
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at a different hotel, but decided that we wanted to be by the beach. After looking at a number of hotels, we found a great value at the Illusion. We got very nice rooms with large romantic beds and sofas for a great price. These rooms led right out to a rooftop deck with beautiful view of the ocean, a pool and poolside bar. The Hotel itself is a half block from a prime location on the beach and half a block from the center of fifth, which is the main street for restaurants, bars, shops, etc.. This made the entire time extremely convenient and fun. In addition, Alex (Manager) and the staff went above and beyond to help plan a very special afternoon and evening for my girlfriend's birthday. This included helping us to get spots for a sold out horse back riding session, getting a cake, filling the room full of balloons, wine, and planning a nice dinner on the beach. Highly recommend this hotel and love Playa. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Right People”
Reviews.Author: jtass1
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa before staying in an all inclusive resort which was great if that is your style. Typically we are explorers and want to be out and about adventuring and soaking up the local culture. If you are more the latter, than The Illusion can be a great place to stay. What makes it great is the staff and the environment they create. Friendly, welcoming, accomodating and always willing to help. On the rooftop is a nice get away area that also brings guests together. Bartender (and morning chef) Javier makes sure the drinks and fun are flowing. The location is great for beach access and downtown activity. Not more than a few steps from either. Being able to come and go easily and have a friendly "home" away from home is nice. We also had the rare delight of meeting some great new friends and getting to know them while there, which made the Illusion all that more of a find for us. If you desire to create your own activities, are out going and enjoy meeting and mixing with folks, or just want a well located quiet get away, try The Illusion. If you want to lay around poolside and drink and eat alot, go to an all inclusive. Adventurers from The Woodlands, TX.

Reviews.Title: “best service”
Reviews.Author: busan
Reviews.Content: We were very well welcomed to the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very fresh and clean. The room had very good standard and felt very comfortable. The best with the hotel was the friendly and humoristic staff, that made us feel relaxed and warmly welcomed. We will recommend Illusion Boutique Hotel to you and all our friends. And next time we will visit Mexico, we know where to stay. Magnus och Ewa from Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, management & location!”
Reviews.Author: OBXSkiff
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Mexico, and we wanted to stay close to all the action..., restaurants, stores, bars & live entertainment. The Illusion Boutiqe Hotel exceeded our expectations with regards to location, and everything else one might expect from a hotel! From the moment we first arrived, we were greeted by friendly, smiling people looking to go out of their way to assure us that we had arrived at the right place. Our first impression of the hotel was that the place was very clean, exceptionally well maintained, and with only 40 rooms, completely uncrowded. Our room was spotless, and equipped with everything we might need or want during our stay. Our first stop was to the rooftop pool and cabana bar. Javier quickly served up a couple cerveca's, and within minutes we were making new friends. Over the next few days, we met three great couples, from all different areas, and spent time together going out to dinner and just getting to know new people. Each morning we treated ourselves to a delicious omelet from the omelet bar, along with other goodies, great coffee, all while sitting in the open air courtyard...very relaxing! Our room, located rooftop pool level, was very convenient, and the area provides beautiful ocean views, plenty of chairs, umbrellas etc., for taking in a good book, and a quick jump in the pool to cool off from the hot afternoon sun. Not to mention, you are right there for the afternnoon cocktails served up poolside! Every night we were a minute's walk from fine restaurants, live entertainment, great stores, yet just off the main walk. My wife could shop during the day to her hearts content, and be back to the hotel within minutes to meet up for lunch, or travel off to our next destination. Hotel location was great! From beginning to end, we were well taken care of by all the staff and management, and have returned home to share our great experience with our other traveling friends. They are now all ready to book a trip to the Illusion Boutique Hotel, and of course, we will be there again as well! Happy traveling, Richard & Melanie Tolson NC Outer Banks

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Cath_Paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good compromise : the + : Good location Not crowded (no kids/no animal allowed) Friendly staff and friendly international customers Clean Large room (but ask for a room at the upper level) Terrace with small pool (to freshen up) the - : No private parking lot but park anywhere above the avenida 15 /calle 4 for example (and walk 10mn to your hotel) You cannot reach the hotel by car :you have to walk up from avenida 10 Cannot sleep until noon, as it's getting noisy around 8 oclock in the morning

Reviews.Title: “loved the illusion”
Reviews.Author: Hauan123
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Illusions on a short notice trip. we loved the place. It is small about 35 rooms. rooms were very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. they supplied beach towels for us every day. The continental breakfast was free and very exellent. Armondo was particularly helpful. we asked about how good the coffee was and he offered to go to sams and pick it up for us. the breakfast omlettes for 50 pesos was an exellent value and very good. this hotel is a real value, the food good, and the location perfect just a block of of 5 th and half a block to the beach. we will definatly return here. Bruce and Cindy

Reviews.Title: “Nice and charming”
Reviews.Author: fangxz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. This hotel was exactly what we wanted for our vacation. It's centrally located, near the beach, stylish, with a nice rooftop pool... We liked walking on 5th Ave and trying out all the nice restaurants and bars. The room was clean. We liked the spacious shower. The staffs are personable. Valentina at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. We had drinks at the bar next to the rooftop pool one afternoon, overlooking the ocean. It was the most relaxing experience during our stay. There was a rooster next door which woke us up at 5 in the morning for the first two days of our stay, it was very annoying. It didn't make any sound during the rest of our stay. Don't know what happened to it. Breakfast was good at the hotel. The chefs were friendly. But I would prefer to go out to a restaurant for some authentic Mexican breakfast, since we had to pay $5 for eggs anyway. For good tacos close by, try Carboncitos on 4 St. between 5th and 10th Ave. We would definitely come back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately return to the Illusion”
Reviews.Author: allyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Playa with another couple and the four of us kept wondering why the bad reviews regarding the Illusion. On arrival, we were met, 1/2 way down the street, by Isidro, staff member who came to assist bringing our luggage into the hotel as the Calle 8 is blocked off from auto traffic and we had to walk from Avenue 10. At check in, we were greeted by front desk personnel Valentina who was just wonderful.. All of the staff, including the two chefs who made breakfast, were friendly, and seemed to be on a first name basis with every hotel guest. The hotel is clean. It is a few steps to the beach, and a few steps to Avenida Cinco. If you are looking for the ultimate in luxury and pampering, huge buffet breakfasts, lines at lunch, having to be shuttled to the beach and or pool, kids all over the place and running into hotel guests at every turn, then don't go to the Illusion. If you are looking for a quiet hotel, with friendly staff, clean rooms, proximity to the beach and town, and a relatively private environment, then the Illusion is a great place. We will definately return !!!! For breakfast, try the Shasta Cafe, on Ave.5. For lunch, try the Blue Parrot Beach Bar; for Dinner try the Blue Parrot,; Don Emiliones (traditional mexican), and for late night snack, the "Empanada Man", on Ave. 5 between Calle 10 and Calle 12.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxxx-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa four times and we have stayed at other more expensive hotels. We took a chance staying at the Illusion which paid off!!!!!!!!!! The rooms are simple but VERY clean. We upgraded for 2 days onto the 4th floor where the roms are much larger and have unbeliavable views. Worth every cent of the upgrade! The hotel is perfectly located, a block from the beach and central to everything, however I would walk the five/six blocks to mammetias beach which is much nicer than the beach here. From the rooftop sun deck you can hear the waves and still get the ocean breeze. The staff of this hotel is nothing short of AMAZING. They know the town and can give great restaurant recommendations. Every request was answered immediately. They work incredible long hours yet greet you everytime you walk in with a smile. By the 2nd day they knew our room number and names. The two guys cooking breakfast as so charming its hard to resist both their personalities and the omlettes. Playa is a simple unassuming town. This is not a RESORT this is a small european boutique hotel, a comfortable place to sleep and leave your stuff while you explore this beautiful town. You cant compare hotels here to anything other than other hotels in Playa and by that standard this is cleaner, quietier, better run and managed than anything we have seen. We will be back and will never search for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nancyUsa
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, wonderful staff. No problems. No hair dryer in room but was given one immediately on asking. Breakfast served by private catering very reasonable ($5.00p)with excellent made-to-order omelettes. Great location off 5th but near beach.

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive roof terrace 50 m from the Sea”
Reviews.Author: blondino
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-week trip that actually was our honeymoon. I can tell you that Playa del Carmen is a very charming place and so is this hotel. The breakfast is really small, but the coffee is one of the best I have tasted. Not like a tasteless long Starbuck's one, rather a smaller tasty italian I suppose. And it's worth to have an other cup that they offer you without additional charge. In January it was very windy so that the beautiful roof terrace of which exclusivity is pretty unique in the area, was just perfect. The view is as perfect as it looks on the pics. Great chance to just listen the sound of the sea. The location is also perfect as it is 20ms from Avenida Quinta the main (and the only) shopping street. The prices of food in restaurants are pretty high, but there is a Wal-Mart with Mexican cuisine inside for a 10m walk straight from the hotel that is a good choice for not burning all the money for food. The evenings are sometimes noisy as the restaurant has an attrium and the doors and walls are pretty thin. That is sometimes annoying but I guess that is the only bad thing about the hotel. The members of staff - and the Mexicans in general - are very nice people. They are always cheerful and helpful so finally I can tell you that we had a great stay for honeymoon in Illusion Boutique Hotel and would suggest for you anytime. A tip: Always check around before you choose a tour operator for daily trips because there is always a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Fair but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Travelreina
Reviews.Content: In order: 1. Breakfast (continental) is included, but is awful. Coffee is abysmal, and all you get in addition is some dried toast with margarine and jam. They have one person serving, and he isn't very swift. For instance, he brings you toast but no set-up with which to butter it, and so on. Ask him for something and be prepared for a lengthy wait. All the other hotels serve a solid, enjoyable breakfast choice. We ate at The Alhambra right next door. It was worth paying for. 2. Be VERY VERY careful when checking out. We had spurious charges placed on our bill that we didn't incur. Example: the maids packed a bunch of filthy towels in a plastic bag and said we had left them, so we got a charge. Obviously they weren't satisfied with the propina (tip) we left and decided to stick it to us. Fortunately, the head housekeeper was at the desk when this happened and said outright that these towels weren't ours. They also slapped "Other charges" on our bill that even they couldn't explain. We felt very ripped off. 3. It's far too expensive for what we got, including the fact that they converted pesos at a much higher rate. We wouldn't recommend it. You can probably do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Breathless”
Reviews.Author: Bearfootin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in october had a great time. The hotel was quaint and small. would defintely stay again and longer next time. The staff was very accomondating. Very beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: aquacasa
Reviews.Content: The Illusion Boutique is small, but one of the nicest, friendliest and conveniently located hotels that we have stayed in. It is close to the beach and 5th Ave and nice and quite at night. The Staff was very accommodating and treated us like long lost friends. The poolside afternoon gatherings with the fellow guests, was fun and informative. Everyone felt like part of a family, which made the trip pleasant while sharing stories and adult beverages. As they advertised, no children made it even more relaxing. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We stayed in 210, but will reserve a poolside room on the 4th floor the next time. The elevator should be finished within the next few weeks. It was close to finished when we left. In our opinion, you can’t go wrong with this hotel unless you just love large hotels and just being a number.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Pretty, Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Illusion was really great; they had lots of good suggestions and contacts and were all around friendly. The hotel location is well situated between the beach, the main ave. and the rest of town. Though the hotel was being renovated while we were there in mid-May, we really enjoyed our stay, despite the overbearing construction noise (which is everywhere and inescapable in the main section of Playa del Carmen anyway). Once the banging and clanging subsides it’s all good.

Reviews.Title: “it's okay, not great!”
Reviews.Author: rideonchance
Reviews.Content: huge building project is currently making this a poor hotel choice. our room, 310, was very plain. not at all like the ones the hotel has posted on-line. an elevator is being built in the center courtyard, lots of dust and noise. the breakfast was only pastry and coffe/tea/juice, served in a high dust courtyard. this hotel is very close to a great beach, but stay at the alhambra on the beach instead! playa del carmen has too many cool hotels or really cheap hotels to stay in this one. it just was not that great.

Reviews.Title: “it's perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Illusion hotel is beatiful, The service and people are incredible, The pool and general intalations are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “warning- unwelcoming, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: 4myinfo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday evening with out 2 children (ages 4 and 8) and were greeted in the most unwelcoming manner. Miguel, a manager no less, goes on and on about how they do not allow children to stay there. We booked our room through Expedia and this was not made known to us at any time; we told him we certainly did not want to bring our children where they were not allowed nor wanted, but we had no idea! The room was paid in full and it was doubtful we could get a comparable room at another hotel at that time. I felt terrible about the situation and that we were imposing on them! Just that week I emailed the hotel to confirm the reservation and informed them that our family (including the young ones) were looking forward to spending my 40th birthday there- when I asked Miguel about it he quickly said they never received it. Instead of making the best of a bad situation, Miguel chooses to put us in a smaller room than we paid for based on the idea that a futon only fit into this particular room. When my husband went down to speak with him later that night to make sure everything was ok, Miguel offered to help us look around for another hotel the next day- just what we wanted to do on our 1st day in Mexico! In other words, he wanted us OUT! He even explained that they had gotten a bad review on tripadvisor- (see "lies, lies, lies") because children were there earlier. So, we were made to feel unwelcomed because someone else was angry that children were there in the past! Finally, we asked to be moved to the room we paid for with the balcony, ocean view and king size bed and showed them that a futon would fit in there without a problem (as the room actually is larger). Guess what, the futon fit perfectly and our family had more room. I wonder why Miguel didn't do this for us when we arrived - ? During our stay, we were almost never at the hotel because we did a lot of trips, so our children were not even physically present to bother anyone. (by the way, they were not the loud ones another reviewer referred to....) And the kids were so worn out at night they went straight to sleep. The bar hoppers coming in at night were even louder than our kids. Our kids have traveled quite a bit and stayed at much nicer hotels, so they understand the idea of respecting others. It was such a disappointment to stay at Illusions. We have never been treated so poorly by people who are supposedly in the business of making guests feel comfortable. There were some outstanding staff there including the breakfast staff, and David at the front desk. Cecelia did not smile at us once during our entire time and was there when we checked in pretending to not be able to find our reservation. OTHERWISE, this hotel was mediocre at best...if I were not with children I would much rather stay at a more attractive, exciting, and hip hotel. Burnt out lightbulbs, no sheer curtains, outdated bedding, very little storage space or shelves (just live out of your suitcase), average maid service even if you tip daily, and some awful customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Illusion Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enochNH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Apr 16 to 23 2006. Very nice hotel in a great location. Property was kept clean at all times even though there was construction going on. They are building a new restaurant that should open in May. The spa area is being renovated and is nearly complete. The elevator project will be a little longer but it's in progress- most of the steel has been delivered. The staff here is extremely helpful. We stopped by several times to ask for recomendations and they always had lots of good advice. In particular, David and Ysidro would go out of their way to help at any time. The one fly in the ointment was the adult only hotel issue. They are billed as this but there was a family with 2 very hyper kids that would play in the halls until midnight. After speaking to the desk twice about this, the management finally got control of the situation and the rest of the week was fine. There's many great tours in the area, We rented a car ($50 per day including all taxes and insurance). It gave us much more flexibility than the bus tours could offer. Recomend NOT driving at night! We would visit this area again and stay at this hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Playa since 1995 and have usually stayed at what was Continental Plaza (now Playacar Palace) and we have also stayed at Porto Real. We don't like all inclusives so this time we decided to stay in the middle of town and took a chance on staying at a small hotel. We loved it! It is a wonderful hotel and only 1/2 a block from the beach and maybe 1/2 block to Avenida Cinco (the main street). We splurged and had a room on the 4th floor which is the top floor. Those rooms open up right out to a deck with a tiny waist deep pool and a bar that is open from noon - 6:00 p.m. (although one night there were so many of us there, they stayed open until 8:00 p.m.) We were room 706 and it was the perfect location. The only drawback right now is that they are installing an elevator and the noise is unbearable. During the 4 days we were there they managed to install only one steel beam, so it may be awhile before the elevator is finished. During the day we were not able to lay out on the deck and just relax because of the noise. We ended up hanging out on the beach which we prefer anyway, but it would have been nice to have been able to relax right outside our room at least for a couple of hours since we paid extra for that. My brother and sister-in-law had Room 703 and we could not even hear ourselves talk to each other in their room during the day. The elevator is being installed right outside of that room. We did talk to management because the hours they posted for construction hours were incorrect. The workers started at 8-9 a.m. (so much for sleeping in)and the hours posted were starting at noon. They did offer us to come back and have 3 free nights at a later date, so we'll see if that actually happens. All in all, I would love to stay there again in the same room, but we'll wait until the elevator is finished! LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Illusion staff, location, rooms - all great!”
Reviews.Author: ksummer2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Illusion Boutique Hotel at the end of March and was very satisfied with my choice of hotel after much research. The location is great - 1/2 block from a beautiful beach with choice of beach clubs, and 1/2 block from 5th Ave; yet very quiet. The pool and rooftop deck were perfect - Christian and Rodriguez were tending bar and were very helpful with restaurant and night life suggestions. There was even a band playing one afternoon. Cecilia at the front desk took care of us from the very beginning; she even helped me with activating my cell phone when I arrived, and suggested we go up to the pool/bar to wait after arriving since we were early for check in. The room was very clean and attractive. There is a dive shop right next door on one side and a convenience store on the other. I would go back except that the price was a little high.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic time! We've been to this part of Mexico before but stayed in an all-inclusive resort about 20 minutes south of Playa del Carmen. While we were there we ended up going out to dinner a couple of nights in Playa and always said that if we were to come back to Mexico we would stay right in the center of all the action in Playa...and that's what we did! I had read all the reviews about The Illusion and believed that fellow travelers would not lie...and none of you did! The Illusion turned out to be absolutely perfect for us. My husband and I stayed on the 4th floor, our room opened right out onto the patio with ocean views. The bar was right there, open everyday from noon until 6pm. We would spend the early part of our day on the beach. The street that the Illusion is located on opens up on the best part of the beach. It's not too crowded, the water is crystal clear, and the bottom of the ocean is all sand without any sharp rocks...perfect. I enjoy sitting on a towel on the beach so that I can feel the soft sand underneath me so I didn't mind not having a beach chair. After sunbathing my husband and I would head back to the Illusion, sit outside on the patio overlooking the ocean, have a bite to eat, and enjoy a few afternoon cocktails. The place is very easy and laid back, altho very attentive when you need something. The staff is great. Chris and Dave are the best! We could not have asked for more. Playa del Carmen is a great town because it has so many great restaurants and little shops, but there's still a huge local flavor there which can be hard to find in the Carribean especially when your staying at an all-inclusive. oh, and by the way, we did the ATV tour thru the jungle. It was the best and you can drive fast!!! And one more thing, when you're there take a look at the promotional video...that's us sitting at the bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Location”
Reviews.Author: StewartsLucy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just returning from a week stay at the Illusion Hotel (2/25/06-3/4/06). I work as a flight attendant for a major US airline for many years now, so we get around. We are in our early 40s if this helps. This hotel was very clean and the location is quite convenient. Just between the beach and 5th avenue. Noise was never a problem. There is a minimart right next door for picking up water or munchies, and a farmacia at the corner of 5th ave. and calle 8. We had room #204 which is one of the standard rooms here. There is free wireless internet throughout hotel. It worked very well for us in our room on the 2nd floor. If you don't want to bring your computer, there are 2 internet cafe's right outside the hotel with low rates. The plumbing worked very well! The shower is great, oversized, and the water pressure the strongest I've had in Mexico. We never ran out of hot water. And the toilets flush fine--you can even throw the TP in. For the gals out there, the in-room blow-dryer provided was powerful enough to blow-dry my long, thick, hair in record time. We had a remote control for the A/C, and there is also a ceiling fan. Some of the suggestions we made to hotel that would improve this particular room were; need a sheer curtain to allow light along with privacy. We only had a blackout curtain, and as this hotel is atrium style, we had to keep it pulled when sleeping, getting dressed, or showering. This made the room dark most of the time. We were told on check-out that this was already under consideration and may be coming. We noticed the 4th floor suites had sheer curtains. There is no closet in this room, nor space enough for the two of us to unpack. The luggage rack, hang space is not sufficient. The entire week I had to keep all of my clothes in my suitcase! They need a closet or some dressers pronto. We went through quite a few rainstorms the week we were there, and there was not a lot of room to hang-dry our wet clothes. There is a clothesline in the bathroom that is suitable for bathing suits. They also need a desk and or table in this room. there was no where to put items. There are 2 nightstands, a small decorative table. We needed a place to put our laptop, review travel books & maps. You do have a futon to sit on. I requested a sheet to throw over it and got it. The hotel does not participate with any of the beach clubs, so you will have to rent loungers if you want to stay on the beach--and who doesn't?? There is a roof-top pool (small) and loungers which we enjoyed, but we wouldn't spend the entire week up there. FYI there are beach clubs up and down the beach in Playa, with 2 right at the end of Calle 8. The roof-top bar also offers happy hour. The coffee served at the continental breakfast wasdelicious. You get a fresh squeezed glass of OJ and a basket of rolls. If you want more, it is available but you must pay for it. After the big dinners we had, the continental was plenty for us. The staff were friendly and accomadating. The maid service was good, again, the room was super clean. Special thanks to our server Christian for his hospitality, and Miguel for his assistance with our reservation. We booked the airport transfer through the hotel via STP Caribe. It cost $100 USD round-trip for a private van with A/C that worked out very well. We would recommend the Illusion. Enjoy your stay in beautiful Playa del Carmen!

HotelInfo.Name: Illusion Boutique Hotel by Xperience Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 8 Nte. | Entre 5a Ave y ZFM Lote 10, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
